quote0.quote: This is the miracle that happens every time to those who really love; the more they give, the more they possess.
quote0.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote1.quote: The bottom line is that (a) people are never perfect, but love can be, (b) that is the one and only way that the mediocre and vile can be transformed, and (c) doing that makes it that. We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love.
quote1.author: Tom Robbins

quote2.quote: We are nearer loving those who hate us than those who love us more than we wish.
quote2.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote3.quote: We love those who admire us, but not those whom we admire.
quote3.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote4.quote: What makes lovers never tire of one another is that they talk always about themselves.
quote4.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote5.quote: It is with true love as it is with ghosts; everyone talks about it, but few have seen it.
quote5.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote6.quote: If we are to judge of love by its consequences, it more nearly resembles hatred than friendship.
quote6.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote7.quote: There are few people who are not ashamed of their love affairs when the infatuation is over.
quote7.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote8.quote: The more one loves a mistress, the more one is ready to hate her.
quote8.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote9.quote: True love is like ghosts, which everyone talks about and few have seen.
quote9.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote10.quote: There is no disguise which can hide love for long where it exists, or simulate it where it does not.
quote10.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quote11.quote: Love is not love until love's vulnerable.
quote11.author: Theodore Roethke

quote12.quote: I never met a man I didn't like.
quote12.author: Will Rogers

quote13.quote: The value of love will always be stronger than the value of hate.. Any nation or group of nations which employs hatred eventually is torn to pieces by hatred...
quote13.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote14.quote: Love shall be our token; love be yours and love be mine.
quote14.author: Christina Rossetti

quote15.quote: Love is the last relay and ultimate outposts of eternity.
quote15.author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti

quote16.quote: Love is the direct opposite of hate. By definition it's something you can't feel for more than a few minutes at a time, so what's all this bullshit about loving somebody for the rest of your life?
quote16.author: Judith Rossner

quote17.quote: Our affections as well as our bodies are in perpetual flux.
quote17.author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

quote18.quote: Falling in love consists merely in uncorking the imagination and bottling the common-sense.
quote18.author: Helen Rowland

quote19.quote: Between lovers a little confession is a dangerous thing.
quote19.author: Helen Rowland

quote20.quote: It is easier to keep half a dozen lovers guessing than to keep one lover after he has stopped guessing.
quote20.author: Helen Rowland

quote21.quote: Love life and life will love you back. Love people and they will love you back.
quote21.author: Arthur Rubinstein

quote22.quote: Let the lover be disgraceful, crazy, absent-minded. Someone sober will worry about events going badly. Let the lover be.
quote22.author: Rumi

quote23.quote: Only from the heart Can you touch the sky.
quote23.author: Rumi

quote24.quote: The minute I heard my first love story I started looking for you, not knowing how blind that was. Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.
quote24.author: Rumi

quote25.quote: Religion it self is nothing else but Love to God and Man.He that lives in Love lives in God, says the Beloved Disciple: And to be sure a Man can live no where better. It is most reasonable Men should value that Benefit, which is most durable. Now Tongues shall cease, and Prophecy fail, and Faith shall be consummated in Sight, and Hope in Enjoyment; but Love remains.Love is indeed Heaven upon Earth; since Heaven above would not be Heaven without it: For where there is not Love; there is Fear: But perfect Love casts out Fear. And yet we naturally fear most to offend what we most Love. What we Love, we
quote25.author: William PennFruits of Solitude

quote26.quote: Love is not the dying moan of a distant violin-it's the triumphant twang of a bedspring.
quote26.author: S. J. Perelman

quote27.quote: To be able to say how much love, is love but little.
quote27.author: Francesco Petrarch

quote28.quote: Pure love is a willingness to give without a thought of receiving anything in return.
quote28.author: Peace Pilgrim

quote29.quote: The way of peace is the way of love. Love is the greatest power on earth. It conquers all things.
quote29.author: Peace Pilgrim

quote30.quote: At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet.
quote30.author: Plato

quote31.quote: Love is a serious mental disease.
quote31.author: Plato

quote32.quote: Love is the joy of the good, the wonder of the wise, the amazement of the Gods.
quote32.author: Plato

quote33.quote: We all suffer from the preoccupation that there exists ... in the loved one, perfection.
quote33.author: Sidney Poitier

quote35.quote: An orange on the table, your dress on the rug, and you in my bed, sweet present of the present, cool of night, warmth of my life.
quote35.author: Jacques Prevert

quote36.quote: Fantastic tyrant of the amorous heart. How hard thy yoke, how cruel thy dart. Those escape your anger who refuse your sway, and those are punished most, who most obey.
quote36.author: Matthew Prior

quote37.quote: People who are not in love fail to understand how an intelligent man can suffer because of a very ordinary woman. This is like being surprised that anyone should be stricken with cholera because of a creature so insignificant as the comma bacillus.
quote37.author: Marcel Proust

quote38.quote: In a separation it is the one who is not really in loved who says the more tender things.
quote38.author: Marcel Proust

quote39.quote: Being in love was like China: you knew it was there, and no doubt it was very interesting, and some people went there, but I never would. I'd spend all my life without ever going to China, but it wouldn't matter, because there was all the rest of the world to visit.
quote39.author: Phillip Pullman

quote40.quote: Love is an expression and assertion of self-esteem, a response to one's own values in the person of another. One gains a profoundly personal, selfish joy from the mere existence of the person one loves. It is one's own personal, selfish happiness that one seeks, earns, and derives from love.
quote40.author: Ayn Rand

quote41.quote: If we love our country, we should also love our countrymen.
quote41.author: Ronald Reagan

quote42.quote: He Freud often said three things were impossible to fulfill completely; healing, education, governing. He limited his goals in analytic treatment to brining the patient to the point where he could work for a living and learn to love.
quote42.author: Theodor Reik

quote43.quote: The man who has never made a fool of himself in love will never be wise in love.
quote43.author: Theodor Reik

quote44.quote: Love is like an hourglass, with the heart filling up as the brain empties.
quote44.author: Jules Renard

quote45.quote: Love is like the measles, all the worse when it comes late.
quote45.author: Mary Roberts Rhinehart

quote46.quote: We who were loved will never unlive that crippling fever.
quote46.author: Adrienne Rich

quote47.quote: Love is what is left in a relationship after all the selfishness is taken out.
quote47.author: Nick Richardson

quote48.quote: A woman who could always love would never grow old; and the love of mother and wife would often give or preserve many charms if it were not too often combined with parental and conjugal anger. There remains in the face of women who are naturally serene and peaceful, and of those rendered so by religion, an after-spring, and later an after-summer, the reflex of their most beautiful bloom.
quote48.author: Jean Paul Richter

quote49.quote: For one human being to love another: that is perhaps the most difficult of all our tasks, the ultimate, the last test and proof, the work for which all other work is but preparation.
quote49.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote50.quote: This was love at first sight, love everlasting: a feeling unknown, unhoped for, unexpected - in so far as it could be a matter of conscious awareness; it took entire possession of him, and he understood, with joyous amazement, that this was for life.
quote50.author: Thomas Mann

quote51.quote: If only one could tell true love from false love as one can tell mushrooms from toadstools.
quote51.author: Katherine Mansfield

quote52.quote: A love affair with knowledge will never end in heartbreak.
quote52.author: Michael Garrett Marino

quote53.quote: He drew a circle that shut me out--Heretic, rebel, a thing to flout.But Love and I had the wit to win:We drew a circle that took him in.
quote53.author: Edwin MarkhamOutwitted

quote54.quote: Who ever loved that loved not at first sight?
quote54.author: Christopher Marlowe

quote55.quote: Where both deliberate, the love is slight: Who ever lov'd, that lov'd not at first sight?
quote55.author: Christopher Marlowe

quote56.quote: There is no living with thee, nor without thee.
quote56.author: Marcus Valerius Martial

quote57.quote: I would not miss your face, your neck, your hands, your limbs, your bosom and certain other of your charms. Indeed, not to become boring by naming them all, I could do without you, Chloe, altogether.
quote57.author: Marcus Valerius Martial

quote58.quote: If there is any country on earth where the course of true love may be expected to run smooth, it is America.
quote58.author: Harriet Martineau

quote59.quote: This world is full of beauty, as other worlds above, and if we did our duty, it might be as full of love.
quote59.author: Gerald Massey

quote60.quote: It is remarkable how similar the pattern of love is to the pattern of insanity.
quote60.author: The Matrix - Revolutionscharacter Merovingian

quote61.quote: I learnt that men were moved by a savage egoism, that love was only the dirty trick nature played on us to achieve the continuation of the species.
quote61.author: W. Somerset MaughamThe Summing Up 1938, Chapter XXI

quote62.quote: Love is what happens to a man and woman who don't know each other.
quote62.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote63.quote: Love means the body, the soul, the life, the entire being. We feel love as we feel the warmth of our blood, we breathe love as we breathe air, we hold it in ourselves as we hold our thoughts. Nothing more exists for us.
quote63.author: Maupassant

quote64.quote: A mixture of admiration and pity is one of the surest recipes for affection.
quote64.author: Andre Maurois

quote65.quote: The love boat has crashed against the everyday.
quote65.author: Vladimir Mayakovsky

quote67.quote: It is by loving and by being loved that one can come nearest to the soul of another.
quote67.author: George Mcdonald

quote68.quote: Two halves have little choice but to join;And yes, they do make a wholebut two wholes when they coincide...That is beauty.That is love.
quote68.author: Peter McWilliams(quoted by marital therapist- David Schnarch in Constructing the Sexual Crucible)

quote69.quote: Love is an emotion that is based on an opinion of women that is impossible for those who have had any experience with them.
quote69.author: H. L. Mencken

quote70.quote: Love is the delusion that one man or woman differs from another.
quote70.author: H. L. Mencken

quote71.quote: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.
quote71.author: H. L. Mencken

quote72.quote: To be in love is merely to be in a perpetual state of anesthesia.
quote72.author: H. L. Mencken

quote73.quote: One does not fall in love; one grows into love, and love grows in him.
quote73.author: Karl Menninger

quote74.quote: Love cures people -- both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.
quote74.author: Karl Menninger

quote75.quote: The best way will be to avoid each other without appearing to do so -- or if we jostle, at any rate not to bite.
quote75.author: Lord (George Gordon) Byron

quote76.quote: Lovers may be -- and indeed generally are -- enemies, but they never can be friends, because there must always be a spice of jealousy and a something of Self in all their speculations.
quote76.author: Lord (George Gordon) Byron

quote77.quote: In love, as in gluttony, pleasure is a matter of the utmost precision.
quote77.author: Italo Calvino

quote78.quote: The desire for possession is insatiable, to such a point that it can survive even love itself. To love, therefore, is to sterilize the person one loves.
quote78.author: Albert Camus

quote79.quote: Son, I'd say you were going at it the wrong end first, said the Judge, turning up his coat-collar. How could you care about one girl? Have you ever cared about one leaf?Riley, listening to the wildcat with an itchy hunter's look, snatched at the leaves blowing about us like midnight butterflies; alive, fluttering as though to escape and fly, one stayed trapped between his fingers. The Judge, too: he caught a leaf; and it was worth more in his hand than in Riley's. Pressing it mildly against his cheek, he distantly said, We are speaking of love. A leaf, a handful of seed--begin with these, learn a little what it is to love. First, a leaf, a fall of rain, then someone to receive what a leaf has taught you, what a fall of rain has ripened. No easy process, understand; it could take a lifetime, it has mine, and still I've never mastered it--I only know how true it is: that love is a chain of love, as nature is a chain of life.
quote79.author: Truman CapoteThe Glass Harp

quote80.quote: The true beloveds of this world are in their lover's eyes lilacs opening, ship lights, school bells, a landscape, remembered conversations, friends, a child's Sunday, lost voices, one's favorite suit, autumn and all seasons, memory, yes, it being the earth and water of existence, memory.
quote80.author: Truman Capote

quote81.quote: Love is not altogether a delirium, yet it has many points in common therewith.
quote81.author: Thomas Carlyle

quote82.quote: You can give without loving, but you cannot love without giving.
quote82.author: Amy Carmichael

quote83.quote: Everybody forgets the basic thing; people are not going to love you unless you love them.
quote83.author: Pat Carroll

quote84.quote: It is difficult to lay aside a confirmed passion.
quote84.author: Catullus

quote85.quote: Love, Arthur, is a poodle's chance of attaining the infinite, and personally I have my pride.
quote85.author: Louis-Ferdinand Celine

quote86.quote: A relationship is like a rose,How long it lasts, no one knows;Love can erase an awful past,Love can be yours, you'll see at last;To feel that love, it makes you sigh,To have it leave, you'd rather die;You hope you've found that special rose,'Cause you love and care for the one you chose.
quote86.author: Rob Cella

quote87.quote: 'Tis said of love that it sometimes goes, sometimes flies; runs with one, walks gravely with another; turns a third into ice, and sets a fourth in a flame: it wounds one, another it kills: like lightning it begins and ends in the same moment: it makes that fort yield at night which it besieged but in the morning; for there is no force able to resist it.
quote87.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote88.quote: Love and war are the same thing, and stratagems and policy are as allowable in the one as in the other.
quote88.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote89.quote: One who has not only the four S's, which are required in every good lover, but even the whole alphabet; as for example... Agreeable, Bountiful, Constant, Dutiful, Easy, Faithful, Gallant, Honorable, Ingenious, Kind, Loyal, Mild, Noble, Officious, Prudent, Quiet, Rich, Secret, True, Valiant, Wise; the X indeed, is too harsh a letter to agree with him, but he is Young and Zealous.
quote89.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote90.quote: Better to have loved a short man than never to have loved a tall.
quote90.author: David Chambless

quote91.quote: When a man and a woman have an overwhelming passion for each other, it seems to me, in spite of such obstacles dividing them as parents or husband, that they belong to each other in the name of Nature, and are lovers by Divine right, in spite of human convention or the laws.
quote91.author: Sebastian Roch Nicolas Chamfort

quote92.quote: True love is the parent of humility.
quote92.author: William Ellery Channing

quote93.quote: Love is the affinity which links and draws together the elements of the world... Love, in fact, is the agent of universal synthesis.
quote93.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quote94.quote: Love alone can unite living beings so as to complete and fulfill them... for it alone joins them by what is deepest in themselves. All we need is to imagine our ability to love developing until it embraces the totality of men and the earth.
quote94.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quote95.quote: Someday, after mastering winds, waves, tides and gravity, we shall harness the energy of love; and for the second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire.
quote95.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quote97.quote: Love means to love that which is unlovable; or it is no virtue at all.
quote97.author: G. K. Chesterton

quote98.quote: The way to love anything is to realize that it might be lost.
quote98.author: G. K. Chesterton

quote99.quote: Many a man has fallen in love with a girl in light so dim he would not have chosen a suit by it.
quote99.author: Maurice Chevalier

quote100.quote: The cure for all ills and wrongs, the cares, the sorrows and the crimes of humanity, all lie in the one word 'love.' It is the divine vitality that everywhere produces and restores life.
quote100.author: Lydia Maria Child

quote101.quote: Do not keep the alabaster boxes of your love and tenderness sealed up until your friends are dead. Fill their lives with sweetness, speak cheering words while their ears can hear, and while their hearts can be thrilled and made happier by them. George
quote101.author: Williams Childs

quote102.quote: Every day I live I am more convinced that the waste of life lies in the love we have not given, the powers we have not used, the selfish prudence that will risk nothing and which, shirking pain, misses happiness as well.
quote102.author: Mary Cholmondeley

quote103.quote: Love is the word used to label the sexual excitement of the young, the habituation of the middle-aged, and the mutual dependence of the old.
quote103.author: John Ciardi

quote104.quote: You can't put a price tag on love, but you can on all its accessories.
quote104.author: Melanie Clark

quote105.quote: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.
quote105.author: Paulo CoelhoThe Alchemist

quote106.quote: All thoughts, all passions, all delightsWhatever stirs this mortal frameAll are but ministers of LoveAnd feed His sacred flame.
quote106.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote107.quote: Sympathy constitutes friendship; but in love there is a sort of antipathy, or opposing passion. Each strives to be the other, and both together make up one whole.
quote107.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote108.quote: Friendship often ends in love; but love in friendship - never.
quote108.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote109.quote: If you cannot inspire a woman with love of you, fill her above the brim with love of herself; all that runs over will be yours.
quote109.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote110.quote: Love is an alliance of friendship and animalism; if the former predominates it is passion exalted and refined; if the latter, gross and sensual.
quote110.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote111.quote: To love a thing means wanting it to live.
quote111.author: Confucius

quote112.quote: Can there be a love which does not make demands on its object?
quote112.author: Confucius

quote113.quote: If there's delight in love, 'Tis when I see that heart, which others bleed for, bleed for me.
quote113.author: William Congreve

quote114.quote: We love but once, for once only are we perfectly equipped for loving.
quote114.author: Cyril Connolly

quote115.quote: There is no pain equal to that which two lovers can inflict on one another. This should be made clear to all who contemplate such a union. The avoidance of this pain is the beginning of wisdom, for it is strong enough to contaminate the rest of our lives.
quote115.author: Cyril Connolly

quote116.quote: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.
quote116.author: Joseph Conrad

quote117.quote: Love is a tyrant sparing none.
quote117.author: Pierre Corneille

quote118.quote: Love is a friendship set to music.
quote118.author: E. Joseph Cossman

quote119.quote: Love - THE FEELING - is a fruit of love, the verb.
quote119.author: Stephen Covey

quote120.quote: Love is a fire. But whether it is going to warm your hearth or burn down your house, you can never tell.
quote120.author: Joan Crawford

quote121.quote: Love touched her heart, and lo! It beats high, and burns with such brave hearts.
quote121.author: Richard Crawshaw

quote122.quote: Love is the extra effort we make in our dealings with those whom we do not like and once you understand that, you understand all. This idea that love overtakes you is nonsense. This is but a polite manifestation of sex. To love another you have to undertake some fragment of their destiny.
quote122.author: Quentin Crisp

quote123.quote: I love you, not for what you are, but for what I am when I am with you.
quote123.author: Roy Croft

quote124.quote: Men and women are not free to love decently until they have analyzed themselves completely and swept away every mystery from sex; and this means the acquisition of a profound philosophical theory based on wide reading of anthropology and enlightened practice.
quote124.author: Aleister Crowley

quote125.quote: The greatest gift that you can give to others is the gift of unconditional love and acceptance.
quote125.author: Brian Tracy

quote126.quote: To love one person with a private love is poor and miserable: to love all is glorious.
quote126.author: Thomas Traherne

quote127.quote: You are my lover and I am your mistress and kingdoms and empires and governments have tottered and succumbed before now to that mighty combination.
quote127.author: Violet Trefusis

quote128.quote: Love is everything. It is the key to life, and its influences are those that move the world.
quote128.author: Ralph Waldo Trine

quote129.quote: What is the main thing in love? to know and to hide. To know about the one you love and to hide that you love. At times the hiding (shame) overpowers the knowing (passion). The passion for the hidden -- the passion for the revealed.
quote129.author: Marina Ivanova Tsvetaeva

quote130.quote: Listen! Encourage. Say something. Do something. Be yourself. Love
quote130.author: Rev. Dale Turner

quote131.quote: For it is the suffering flesh, it is suffering, it is death, that lovers perpetuate upon the earth. Love is at once the brother, son, and father of death, which is its sister, mother, and daughter. And thus it is that in the depth of love there is a depth
quote131.author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote132.quote: Many will detest you if you spend all your love on yourself.
quote132.author: Source Unknown

quote133.quote: Without His love I can do nothing, with His love there is nothing I cannot do.
quote133.author: Source Unknown

quote134.quote: What's so remarkable about Love at first sight? It's when people have been looking at each other for years that it becomes remarkable.
quote134.author: Source Unknown

quote135.quote: What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.
quote135.author: Source Unknown

quote136.quote: We will invent new lullabies, new songs, new acts of love, we will cry over things we used to laugh and our new wisdom will bring tears to eyes of gentle creatures from other planets who were afraid of us till then and in the end a summer with wild winds and new friends will be.
quote136.author: Source Unknown

quote137.quote: True love means two seeds grow separately until they join in Matrimony forever.
quote137.author: Source Unknown

quote138.quote: Those who haven't loved somebody else, more than they love themselves haven't even begun to live
quote138.author: Source Unknown

quote139.quote: There are no guarantees. From the viewpoint of fear, none are strong enough. From the viewpoint of love, none are necessary.
quote139.author: Source Unknown

quote140.quote: The rose speaks of love silently, in a language known only to the heart.
quote140.author: Source Unknown

quote141.quote: Once you have learned to love, You will have learned to live.
quote141.author: Source Unknown

quote142.quote: Never try to define love. Once defined love is confined. Once confined -- It dies.
quote142.author: Source Unknown

quote143.quote: LOVE, the feeling, is the fruit of LOVE, the verb.
quote143.author: Source Unknown

quote144.quote: Love will find a way. Indifference will find an excuse.
quote144.author: Source Unknown

quote145.quote: Love may be blind, but it can sure find its way around in the dark!
quote145.author: Source Unknown

quote146.quote: Love is the poetry of the senses.
quote146.author: Source Unknown

quote147.quote: Love is the bridge between two hearts.
quote147.author: Source Unknown

quote148.quote: Love is like a poisonous mushroom -- you don't know if it is the real thing until it is too late
quote148.author: Source Unknown

quote149.quote: Live for love. Without love, you don't live.
quote149.author: Source Unknown

quote150.quote: Women wish to be loved not because they are pretty, or good, or well bred, or graceful, or intelligent, but because they are themselves.
quote150.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote151.quote: In real love you want the other person's good. In romantic love, you want the other person.
quote151.author: Margaret Anderson

quote152.quote: A bizarre sensation pervades a relationship of pretense. No truth seems true. A simple morning's greeting and response appear loaded with innuendo and fraught with implications. Each nicety becomes more sterile and each withdrawal more permanent.
quote152.author: Maya Angelou

quote153.quote: Love - a wildly misunderstood although highly desirable malfunction of the heart which weakens the brain, causes eyes to sparkle, cheeks to glow, blood pressure to rise and the lips to pucker
quote153.author: Anonymous

quote154.quote: There is love of course. And then there's life, its enemy.
quote154.author: Jean Anouilh

quote155.quote: Well-ordered self-love is right and natural.
quote155.author: Thomas Aquinas

quote156.quote: Love is made by two people, in different kinds of solitude. It can be in a crowd, but in an oblivious crowd.
quote156.author: Louis Aragon

quote157.quote: Oh, love is real enough; you will find it someday, but it has one archenemy -- and that is life.
quote157.author: Jean Anouilh Ardele

quote158.quote: Love is, above all, the gift of oneself.
quote158.author: Jean Anouilh Ardele

quote159.quote: Love, by its very nature, is unworldly, and it is for this reason rather than its rarity that it is not only apolitical but anti-political, perhaps the most powerful of all anti-political human forces.
quote159.author: Hannah Arendt

quote160.quote: The two qualities which chiefly inspire regard and affection Are that a thing is your own and that it is your only one.
quote160.author: Aristotle

quote161.quote: Most people would rather give than get affection.
quote161.author: Aristotle

quote162.quote: Wicked men obey from fear; good men, from love.
quote162.author: Aristotle

quote163.quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
quote163.author: Aristotle

quote164.quote: One can be a soldier without dying, and a lover without sighing.
quote164.author: Sir Edwin Arnold

quote165.quote: In a great romance, each person plays a part the other really likes.
quote165.author: Elizabeth Ashley

quote166.quote: Being always overavid, I demand from those I love a love equal to mine, which, being balanced people, they cannot supply.
quote166.author: Sylvia Ashton-Warner

quote167.quote: Love is the victim's response to the rapist.
quote167.author: Ti-Grace Atkinson

quote168.quote: We must love one another or die.
quote168.author: W. H. Auden

quote169.quote: We are not commanded (or forbidden) to love our mates, our children, our friends, our country because such affections come naturally to us and are good in themselves, although we may corrupt them. We are commanded to love our neighbor because our natural attitude toward the other is one of either indifference or hostility.
quote169.author: W. H. Auden

quote170.quote: A false enchantment can all too easily last a lifetime.
quote170.author: W. H. Auden

quote171.quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.
quote171.author: Marcus Aurelius

quote172.quote: In nine cases out of ten, a woman had better show more affection than she feels.
quote172.author: Jane Austen

quote173.quote: Not all of us have to possess earthshaking talent. Just common sense and love will do.
quote173.author: Myrtle Auvil

quote174.quote: Real love stories never have endings.
quote174.author: Richard Bach

quote175.quote: Love conquers all; let us surrender to Love.
quote175.author: Virgil

quote176.quote: Nunc scio quit sit amor.Lat., Now I know what love is.
quote176.author: Virgil

quote177.quote: Love is a canvas furnished by Nature and embroidered by imagination.
quote177.author: Voltaire (FranĂ§ois-Marie Arouet)

quote178.quote: If somebody says, I love you, to me, I feel as though I had a pistol pointed at my head. What can anybody reply under such conditions but that which the pistol-holder requires? I love you, too.
quote178.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote179.quote: I have learned not to worry about love; but to honor its coming with all my heart.
quote179.author: Alice Walker

quote180.quote: Fantasy love is much better than reality love. Never doing it is very exciting. The most exciting attractions are between two opposites that never meet.
quote180.author: Andy Warhol

quote181.quote: I never loved another person the way I loved myself.
quote181.author: Mae West

quote182.quote: A man in love is like a clipped coupon -- it's time to cash in.
quote182.author: Mae West

quote183.quote: It has ever been since time began, and ever will be, till time lose breath, that love is a mood --no more --to man, and love to a woman is life or death.
quote183.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote184.quote: In the long run all love is paid by love, Though undervalued by the hosts of earth; The great eternal Government above Keeps strict account and will redeem its worth. Give thy love freely; do not count the cost; So beautiful a thing was never lostIn the long run.
quote184.author: Ella Wheeler WilcoxIn The Long Run

quote185.quote: My tears of love are a waste of time if I turn away
quote185.author: Kim Wilde

quote186.quote: Yet each man kills the thing he loves from all let this be heard some does it with a bitter look some with a flattering word the coward does it with a kiss the brave man with the sword.
quote186.author: Oscar Wilde

quote187.quote: One should always be in love. That is the reason one should never marry.
quote187.author: Oscar Wilde

quote188.quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
quote188.author: Oscar Wilde

quote189.quote: When a man has once loved a woman, he will do anything for her, except continue to love her.
quote189.author: Oscar Wilde

quote190.quote: There is always something ridiculous about the emotions of people whom one has ceased to love.
quote190.author: Oscar Wilde

quote191.quote: There's nothing in the world like the devotion of a married woman. It's a thing no married man knows anything about.
quote191.author: Oscar Wilde

quote192.quote: Love is not only something you feel. It's something you do.
quote192.author: David Wilkerson

quote193.quote: Oh, Jacques, we're used to each other, we're a pair of captive hawks caught in the same cage, and so we've grown used to each other. That's what passes for love at this dim, shadowy end of the Camino Real.
quote193.author: Tennessee (Thomas Lanier) Williams

quote194.quote: It is at the edge of a petal that love waits.
quote194.author: William Carlos Williams

quote195.quote: I fell in love with the thought that a human life could be a priestly conduit, a connecting link between earth and sky. As I grew and stumbled and, most important, as I began to love and be loved, I realized that the ultimate priest is the lover inside us
quote195.author: Marianne Williamson

quote196.quote: My wife heard me say I love you a thousand times, but she never once heard me say sorry
quote196.author: Bruce Willis

quote197.quote: Love is the child of illusion and the parent of disillusion.
quote197.author: Sandy Wilson

quote198.quote: No thoughtful man ever came to the end of his life, and had time and a little space of calm from which to look back upon it, who did not know and acknowledge that it was what he had done unselfishly and for others, and nothing else, that satisfied him in the retrospect, and made him feel that he had played the man.
quote198.author: Woodrow Wilson

quote199.quote: However it is debased or misinterpreted, love is a redemptive feature. To focus on one individual so that their desires become superior to yours is a very cleansing experience.
quote199.author: Jeanette Winterson

quote200.quote: Love makes everything that is heavy light.
quote200.author: Thomas Kempis

quote201.quote: Love is swift, sincere, pious, joyful, generous, strong, patient, faithful, prudent, long-suffering, courageous, and never seeking its own; for wheresoever a person seeketh his own, there he falleth from love.
quote201.author: Thomas Kempis

quote202.quote: Love the moment and the energy of the moment will spread beyond all boundaries.
quote202.author: Sister Corita Kent

quote203.quote: The commandment is that you shall love, but when you understand life and yourself, then it is as if you should not need to be commanded, because to love human beings is still the only thing worth living for; without this life you really do not live.
quote203.author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote204.quote: I have decided to stick with love. Hate is too great a burden to bear.
quote204.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote205.quote: At the center of non-violence stands the principle of love.
quote205.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote206.quote: (on love) It's the only thing which allows men and women to stand in a world where gravity always seems to want to pull them down... bring them low... and make them crawl.
quote206.author: Stephen King

quote207.quote: The moment you have in your heart this extraordinary thing called love and feel the depth, the delight, the ecstasy of it, you will discover that for you the world is transformed.
quote207.author: J. Krishnamurti

quote208.quote: The moment you have in your heart this extraordinary thing called love and feel the depth, the delight, the ecstasy of it, you will discover that for you the world is transform.
quote208.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote209.quote: At the beginning and at the end of love, the two lovers are embarrassed to find themselves alone.
quote209.author: Jean De La Bruyere

quote210.quote: The affections are like lightning: you cannot tell where they will strike till they have fallen.
quote210.author: Jean Baptiste Lacordaire

quote211.quote: Whether life is worth living depends on whether there is love in life.
quote211.author: R. D. Laing

quote212.quote: Sometimes, when one person is missing, the whole world seems depopulated.
quote212.author: Alphonse De Lamartine

quote213.quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength; loving someone deeply gives you courage.
quote213.author: Lao-Tzu

quote214.quote: Love and pity and wish well to every soul in the world; dwell in love, and then you dwell in God.
quote214.author: William Law

quote215.quote: Love has no errors, for all errors are the want for love.
quote215.author: William Law

quote216.quote: Ah, then, upon my bedroom I do draw The blind to hide the garden, where the moonEnjoys the open blossoms as they strawTheir beauty for his taking, boon for boon.And I do lift my aching arms to you,And I do lift my anguished, avid breast,And I do weep for very pain of you,And fling myself at the doors of sleep, for rest.
quote216.author: D. H. (David Herbert) LawrenceA Love Song

quote217.quote: Love is the flower of life, and blossoms unexpectedly and without law, and must be plucked where it is found, and enjoyed for the brief hour of its duration.
quote217.author: D. H. (David Herbert) Lawrence

quote218.quote: The world is wonderful and beautiful and good beyond one's wildest imagination. Never, never, never could one conceive what love is, beforehand, never. Life can be great --quite god-like. It can be so. God be thanked I have proved it.
quote218.author: D. H. (David Herbert) Lawrence

quote219.quote: Life and love are life and love, a bunch of violets is a bunch of violets, and to drag in the idea of a point is to ruin everything. Live and let live, love and let love, flower and fade, and follow the natural curve, which flows on, pointless.
quote219.author: D. H. (David Herbert) Lawrence

quote220.quote: I shall always be a priest of love.
quote220.author: D. H. (David Herbert) Lawrence

quote221.quote: My God, these folks don't know how to love -- that's why they love so easily.
quote221.author: D. H. (David Herbert) Lawrence

quote222.quote: We love in another's soul whatever of ourselves we can deposit in it; the greater the deposit, the greater the love.
quote222.author: Irving Layton

quote223.quote: Human Love... It is that extra creation that stands hurt and baffled at the place of death. Being human, wanting children and sunlight and breath to go on, forever.
quote223.author: Christopher Leach

quote224.quote: Love doesn't just sit there like a stone; it has to be made, like bread, remade all the time, made new.
quote224.author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote225.quote: It's afterwards you realize that the feeling of happiness you had with a man didn't necessarily prove that you loved him.
quote225.author: Marguerite Duras

quote226.quote: It's unthinkable not to love --you'd have a severe nervous breakdown. Or you'd have to be Philip Larkin.
quote226.author: Lawrence Durrell

quote227.quote: The richest love is that which submits to the arbitration of time.
quote227.author: Lawrence Durrell

quote228.quote: Romantic love, in pornography as in life, is the mythic celebration of female negation. For a woman, love is defined as her willingness to submit to her own annihilation. The proof of love is that she is willing to be destroyed by the one whom she loves, for his sake. For the woman, love is always self-sacrifice, the sacrifice of identity, will, and bodily integrity, in order to fulfill and redeem the masculinity of her lover.
quote228.author: Andrea Dworkin

quote229.quote: It does say if you don't love your fellow Christians you're not one in the big book.
quote229.author: James Dye

quote230.quote: Love to me is a feeling, to have universal love you have to always feel love no matter what.
quote230.author: James Dye

quote231.quote: Love poems are always cliche to me but not to the person it's for.
quote231.author: James Dye

quote232.quote: Love is the ability and willingness to allow those that you care for to be what they choose for themselves, without any insistence that they satisfy you.
quote232.author: Wayne Dyer

quote233.quote: Loving people live in a loving world. Hostile people live in a hostile world. Same world.
quote233.author: Wayne Dyer

quote234.quote: The pleasures of love are pains that become desirable, where sweetness and torment blend, and so love is voluntary insanity, infernal paradise, and celestial hell -- in short, harmony of opposite yearnings, sorrowful laughter, soft diamond.
quote234.author: Umberto EcoThe Island of the Day Before

quote235.quote: Love is a better teacher than duty.
quote235.author: Albert Einstein

quote236.quote: You can't blame gravity for falling in love.
quote236.author: Albert Einstein

quote237.quote: Gravitation can not be held responsible for people falling in love
quote237.author: Albert Einstein

quote238.quote: A supreme love, a motive that gives a sublime rhythm to a woman's life, and exalts habit into partnership with the soul's highest needs, is not to be had where and how she wills.
quote238.author: George Eliot

quote239.quote: For what is love itself, for the one we love best? An enfolding of immeasurable cares which yet are better than any joys outside our love.
quote239.author: George Eliot

quote240.quote: But that intimacy of mutual embarrassment, in which each feels that the other is feeling something, having once existed, its effect is not to be done away with.
quote240.author: George Eliot

quote241.quote: Love is most nearly itself when here and now cease to matter.
quote241.author: TS (Thomas Stearns) Eliot

quote242.quote: Footfalls echo in the memoryDown the passage which we did not takeTowards the door we never openedInto the rose-garden.My words echoThus, in your mind.
quote242.author: TS (Thomas Stearns) Eliot, "Four Quartets"

quote243.quote: The art of love ... is largely the art of persistence.
quote243.author: Albert Ellis

quote244.quote: If only the strength of the love that people feel when it is reciprocated could be as intense and obsessive as the love we feel when it is not; then marriages would be truly made in heaven.
quote244.author: Ben Elton

quote245.quote: How we glow over these novels of passion, when the story is told with any spark of truth and nature! And what fastens attention, in the intercourse of life, like any passage betraying affection between two parties? Perhaps we never saw them before and never shall meet them again. But we see them exchange a glance or betray a deep emotion, and we are no longer strangers. We understand them and take the warmest interest in the development of the romance. All mankind love a lover.
quote245.author: Ralph Waldo Emersonfrom Love Essays: First Series, 1841

quote246.quote: It happened once that a youth and a maiden beheld each other in a public assembly for the first time
quote246.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson(on meeting Lydia Jackson, who was to be his second wife)

quote247.quote: The moment we indulge our affections, the earth is metamorphosed, there is no winter and no night; all tragedies, all ennui s, vanish, all duties even.
quote247.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote248.quote: The power of love, as the basis of a State, has never been tried.
quote248.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote249.quote: Love and you shall be loved. All love is mathematically just, as much as the two sides of an algebraic equation.
quote249.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote250.quote: I do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz,or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off.I love you as certain dark things are to be loved,in secret, between the shadow and the soul.
quote250.author: Pablo NerudaSonnet XVII

quote251.quote: Love is a state in which a man sees things most decidedly as they are not.
quote251.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote252.quote: The spiritualization of sensuality is called love: it is a great triumph over Christianity.
quote252.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote253.quote: The only abnormality is the incapacity to love.
quote253.author: Anais Nin

quote254.quote: Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.
quote254.author: Anais NinWinter of Artifice, 1945

quote255.quote: In every question and every remark tossed back and forth between lovers who have not played out the last fugue, there is one question and it is this: Is there someone new?
quote255.author: Edna O'Brien

quote256.quote: In the attic, a warhead no doubt burns. Everything is combustible. Faith burns. Trust burns. Everything burns to nothing and even nothing burns. . . . And when there is nothing, there is nothing worth dying for and when there is nothing worth dying for, there is only nothing.
quote256.author: Tim O'BrienThe Nuclear Age (p. 303), 1985

quote257.quote: If love means that one person absorbs the other, then no real relationship exists any more. Love evaporates; there is nothing left to love. The integrity of self is gone.
quote257.author: Ann Oakley

quote258.quote: In love there are two things -- bodies and words.
quote258.author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote259.quote: To love, for us men, is to clasp one woman with our arms, feeling that she lives and breathes just as we do, suffers as we do, thinks with us, loves with us, and, above all, sins with us.
quote259.author: Baroness Emmuska Orczy

quote260.quote: Ama me fideliter!Fidem meam noto:De corde totaliterEt ex mente tota,Sum presentialiterAbsens in remota.Lat: Love me faithfully!/See how I am faithful:/With all my heart/And all my soul/I am with you/Though I am far away.
quote260.author: Carl OrffCarmina Burana, "Omnia Sol Temperat"

quote261.quote: To an ordinary human being, love means nothing if it does not mean loving some people more than others.
quote261.author: George Orwell

quote262.quote: I love a hand that meets my own with a grasp that causes some sensation.
quote262.author: Samuel Osgood

quote263.quote: Nobody can teach you love. Love you have to find yourself, within your being, by raising your consciousness to higher levels. And when love comes, there is no question of responsibility. You do things because you enjoy doing them for the person you love. You are not obliging the person, you are not even wanting anything in return, not even gratitude. On the contrary, you are grateful that the person has allowed you to do something for him. It was your joy, sheer joy. Love knows nothing of responsibility. It does many things, it is very creative; it shares all that it has, but it is not a responsibility, remember. Responsibility is an ugly word in comparison to love. Love is natural. Responsibility is created by the cunning priests, politicians who want to dominate you in the name of God, in the name of the nation, in the name of family, in the name of religion -- any fiction will do. But they don't talk about love. On the contrary, they are all against love, because love is unable to be controlled by them. A man of love acts out of his own heart, not according to any moral code. A man of love will not join the army because it is his responsibility to fight for his nation. A man of love will say there are no nations, and there is no question of any fight.
quote263.author: Osho Chandra Mohan Jain

quote264.quote: Love is much like a wild rose, beautiful and calm, but willing to draw blood in its defense.
quote264.author: Mark Overby

quote265.quote: If any person wish to be idle, let them fall in love.
quote265.author: Ovid

quote266.quote: Love ever gives. Forgives outlives. And ever stands with open hands. And while it lives, it gives. For this is love's prerogatives -- to give, and give, and give.
quote266.author: John Oxenham

quote267.quote: Once when I was young and true, Someone left me sad- Broke my brittle heart in two; And that was very bad. Love is for unlucky folk. Love is but a curse. Once there was a heart I broke; And that, I think, is worse.
quote267.author: Dorothy ParkerA Very Short Song

quote268.quote: Love is like quicksilver in the hand. Leave the fingers open and it stays. Clutch is, and it darts away.
quote268.author: Dorothy Parker

quote269.quote: Scratch a lover, and find a foe.
quote269.author: Dorothy Parker

quote270.quote: When we are in love we seem to ourselves quite different from what we were before.
quote270.author: Blaise Pascal

quote271.quote: No woman marries for money; they are all clever enough, before marrying a millionaire, to fall in love with him first.
quote271.author: Cesare Pavese

quote272.quote: Love is the cheapest of religions.
quote272.author: Cesare Pavese

quote273.quote: Speak low if you speak love.
quote273.author: Don Pedro

quote274.quote: Love is rarer than genius itself. And friendship is rarer than love.
quote274.author: Charles Peguy

quote275.quote: The season of love is the carnival of egoism and it brings a touchstone to our natures.
quote275.author: George Meredith

quote276.quote: Parrots, tortoises and redwoods live a longer life than men do; Men a longer life than dogs do; Dogs a longer life than love does.
quote276.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote277.quote: If I love you Wednesday, What is that to you? I do not love you Thursday -- so much is true.
quote277.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote278.quote: These two imparadised in one another's arms, the happier Eden, shall enjoy their fill of bliss on bliss.
quote278.author: John Milton

quote279.quote: Frustrated love has been the incentive for many great works.
quote279.author: John N. Mitchell

quote280.quote: I was never one to patiently pick up broken fragments and glue them together again and tell myself that the mended whole was as good as new. What is broken is broken -- and I'd rather remember it as it was at its best than mend it and see the broken places as long as I lived.
quote280.author: Margaret Mitchell

quote281.quote: To always be loved one must ever be agreeable.
quote281.author: Mary Wortley Montagu

quote282.quote: I know a love may be revived which absence, inconstancy, or even infidelity has extinguished, but there is no returning from a d?go?t given by satiety.
quote282.author: Mary Wortley Montagu

quote283.quote: Love talked about is easily turned aside, but love demonstrated is irresistible.
quote283.author: Stan Mooneyham

quote284.quote: The hours I spend with you I look upon as sort of a perfumed garden, a dim twilight, and a fountain singing to it... you and you alone make me feel that I am alive. Other men it is said have seen angels, but I have seen thee and thou art enough.
quote284.author: George Moore

quote285.quote: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
quote285.author: George Moore

quote286.quote: Love never reasons, but profusely gives; it gives like a thoughtless prodigal its all, and then trembles least it has done to little.
quote286.author: Hannah More

quote287.quote: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
quote287.author: Mother Theresa

quote288.quote: Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do... but how much love we put in that action.
quote288.author: Mother Theresa

quote289.quote: I try to give to the poor people for love what the rich could get for money. No, I wouldn't touch a leper for a thousand pounds; yet I willingly cure him for the love of God.
quote289.author: Mother Theresa

quote290.quote: I have found the paradox that if I love until it hurts, then there is no hurt, but only more love.
quote290.author: Mother Theresa

quote291.quote: Do not think that love in order to be genuine has to be extraordinary. What we need is to love without getting tired. Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
quote291.author: Mother Theresa

quote292.quote: The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread.
quote292.author: Mother Theresa

quote293.quote: No love is entirely without worth, even when the frivolous calls to the frivolous and the base to the base.
quote293.author: Iris Murdoch

quote294.quote: Falling out of love is chiefly a matter of forgetting how charming someone is.
quote294.author: Iris Murdoch

quote295.quote: Every man needs two women, a quiet home-maker, and a thrilling nymph.
quote295.author: Iris Murdoch

quote296.quote: Love is an emotion experienced by the many and enjoyed by the few.
quote296.author: George Jean Nathan

quote297.quote: Where love and wisdom drink out of the same cup, in this everyday world, it is the exception.
quote297.author: Madame Neckar

quote300.quote: It is well to be happy and wise and well to be honest and true; it is well to be off with the old love, before you are on with the new.
quote300.author: Source Unknown

quote301.quote: Is your love for the Lord sufficient to give all your time and talents to his work?
quote301.author: Source Unknown

quote302.quote: No three words have greater power than I Love You.
quote302.author: Source Unknown

quote303.quote: If there is anything better than to be loved it is loving.
quote303.author: Source Unknown

quote304.quote: If you had it all to do over, would you fall in love with yourself again?
quote304.author: Source Unknown

quote305.quote: If marriage is your object, you'd better start loving your subject.
quote305.author: Source Unknown

quote306.quote: If love is shelter, I'm going to walk in the rain.
quote306.author: Source Unknown

quote307.quote: I define love for our purpose as the passion of one being for another in the hope of being loved in return.
quote307.author: Source Unknown

quote308.quote: But true love is a durable fire, in the mind ever burning. Never sick, never old, never dead. From itself never turning.
quote308.author: Source Unknown

quote309.quote: At any rate, let us love for a while, for a year or so, you and me. That's a form of divine drunkenness that we can all try.
quote309.author: Source Unknown

quote310.quote: As Plato sometimes speaks of the divine love, it arises not out of indigency, as created love does, but out of fullness and redundancy; it is an overflowing fountain, and that love which descends upon created being is a free efflux from the almighty source of love; and it is well pleasing to him that those creatures which he hath made should partake of it.
quote310.author: Source Unknown

quote311.quote: A good marriage winds up as a meeting of minds, which had better be pretty good to start with.
quote311.author: Source Unknown

quote312.quote: If we discovered we only had five minutes left to say all we wanted to say, every telephone booth would be occupied by people telling other people that they loved them.
quote312.author: Source Unknown

quote313.quote: The one who loves least controls the relationship.
quote313.author: Source Unknown

quote314.quote: An affair wants to spill, to share its glory with the world. No act is so private it does not seek applause.
quote314.author: John Updike

quote315.quote: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.
quote315.author: Peter Ustinov

quote316.quote: But I always think that the best way to know God is to love many things.
quote316.author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote317.quote: Love is something eternal; the aspect may change, but not the essence.
quote317.author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote318.quote: The best way to know God is to love many things.
quote318.author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote319.quote: The more I think about it, the more I realize there is nothing more artistic that to love others.
quote319.author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote320.quote: Once a women has given you her heart you can never get rid of the rest of her.
quote320.author: Sir John Vanbrugh

quote321.quote: I've only been in love with a beer bottle and a mirror.
quote321.author: Sid Vicious

quote322.quote: We were two and had but one heart between us.
quote322.author: Francois de Montcorbier Villon

quote323.quote: Love is much nicer to be in than an automobile accident, a tight girdle, a higher tax bracket, or a holding pattern over Philadelphia.
quote323.author: Judith Viorst

quote324.quote: Love is the same as like except you feel sexier.
quote324.author: Judith Viorst

quote325.quote: To love is to place our happiness in the happiness of another.
quote325.author: Gottfried Wilhelm Von Leibniz

quote326.quote: Love is a promise, love is a souvenir, once given never forgotten, never let it disappear.
quote326.author: John Lennon

quote327.quote: We've got this gift of love, but love is like a precious plant. You can't just accept it and leave it in the cupboard or just think it's going to get on by itself. You've got to keep watering it. You've got to really look after it and nurture it.
quote327.author: John Lennon

quote328.quote: What's terrible is to pretend that the second-rate is first-rate, that you don't need love when you do or that you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.
quote328.author: Doris Lessing

quote329.quote: Love one another and you will be happy. It's as simple and as difficult as that.
quote329.author: Michael Leunig

quote330.quote: If you were going to die soon and had only one phone call you could make, who would you call and what would you say? And why are you waiting?
quote330.author: Stephen Levine

quote331.quote: Go to the truth beyond the mind. Love is the bridge.
quote331.author: Stephen Levine

quote332.quote: When I have learnt to love God better than my earthly dearest, I shall love my earthly dearest better than I do now. In so far as I learn to love my earthly dearest at the expense of God and instead of God, I shall be moving towards the state in which I shall not love my earthly dearest at all. When first things are put first, second things are not suppressed but increased.
quote332.author: C.S. Lewis

quote333.quote: Heaven offers nothing that the mercenary soul can desire. It is safe to tell the pure in heart that they shall see God, for only the pure in heart want to. There are rewards that do not sully motives. A man's love for a woman is not mercenary because he wants to marry her, nor his love for poetry mercenary because he wants to read it, nor his love of exercise less disinterested because he wants to run and leap and walk. Love, by definition, seeks to enjoy its object.
quote333.author: C.S. Lewis

quote334.quote: What is love? It is the morning and the evening star.
quote334.author: Sinclair Lewis

quote335.quote: An act of love that fails is just as much a part of the divine life as an act of love that succeeds, for love is measured by fullness, not by reception.
quote335.author: Harold Lokes

quote336.quote: Ah, how skilful grows the hand That obeyeth Love's command! It is the heart, and not the brain, That to the highest doth attain, And he who followeth Love's behest Far excelleth all the rest!published in The Seaside and the Fireside
quote336.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellowfrom The Building of the Ship

quote337.quote: Talk not of wasted affection; affection never was wasted.
quote337.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote338.quote: It is difficult to know at what moment love begins; it is less difficult to know that it has begun.
quote338.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote339.quote: It is a beautiful trait in the lovers character, that they think no evil of the object loved.
quote339.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote340.quote: Love gives itself; it is not bought.
quote340.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote341.quote: Don't be afraid of showing affection. Be warm and tender, thoughtful and affectionate. Men are more helped by sympathy than by service. Love is more than money, and a kind word will give more pleasure than a present.
quote341.author: Sir John Lubbock

quote342.quote: A man has only one escape from his old self: to see a different self in the mirror of some woman's eyes.
quote342.author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote344.quote: Great passions, my dear, don't exist: they're liars fantasies. What do exist are little loves that may last for a short or a longer while.
quote344.author: Anna Magnani

quote345.quote: There is an important difference between love and friendship. While the former delights in extremes and opposites, the latter demands equality.
quote345.author: Madame de Maintenon

quote346.quote: Nowadays men cannot love seven night but they must have all their desires: that love may not endure by reason; for where they be soon accorded and hasty, heat soon it cooleth. Right so fareth love nowadays, soon hot soon cold: this is no stability. But the old love was not so.
quote346.author: Sir Thomas Malory

quote347.quote: Queen Guenever, for whom I make here a little mention, that while she lived she was a true lover, and therefore she had a good end.
quote347.author: Sir Thomas Malory

quote349.quote: Treasure the love you receive above all. It will survive long after your good health has vanished.
quote349.author: Og Mandino

quote350.quote: Let the first impulse pass, wait for the second.
quote350.author: Baltasar Gracian

quote351.quote: God proved His love on the Cross. When Christ hung, and bled, and died, it was God saying to the world, I love you.
quote351.author: Billy Graham

quote352.quote: Love, love, love -- all the wretched cant of it, masking egotism, lust, masochism, fantasy under a mythology of sentimental postures, a welter of self-induced miseries and joys, blinding and masking the essential personalities in the frozen gestures of courtship, in the kissing and the dating and the desire, the compliments and the quarrels which vivify its barrenness.
quote352.author: Germaine Greer

quote353.quote: Love is a snowmobile racing across the tundra and then suddenly it flips over, pinning you underneath. At night, the ice weasels come.
quote353.author: Matt Groening

quote354.quote: Love is a perky elf dancing a merry little jig and then suddenly he turns on you with a miniature machine gun.
quote354.author: Matt Groening

quote355.quote: Two separate, distinct personalities, not separate at all, but inextricably bound, soul and body and mind, to each other, how did we get so far apart so fast?
quote355.author: Judith Guest

quote356.quote: Any woman who thinks the way to a man's heart is through his stomach is aiming about 10 inches too high.
quote356.author: Adrienne Gusoff

quote357.quote: Only the words of love kept alive are worthy of not being wasted
quote357.author: Arlo Guthrie

quote358.quote: Love is a gift from God, and as we obey His laws and genuinely learn to serve others, we develop God's love in our lives. Love of God is the means of unlocking divine powers which help us to live worthily and to overcome the world.
quote358.author: David B. Haight

quote359.quote: We really have to understand the person we want to love. If our love is only a will to possess, it is not love. If we only think of ourselves, if we know only our own needs and ignore the needs of the other person, we cannot love.
quote359.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote360.quote: There is always something left to love. And if you ain't learned that, you ain't learned nothing. Have you cried for that boy today? I don't mean for yourself and for the family 'cause we lost the money. I mean for him; what he's been through and what it done to him. Child, when do you think is the time to love somebody the most; when they done good and made things easy for everybody? Well then, you ain't through learning -- because that ain't the time at all. It's when he's at his lowest and can't believe in hisself 'cause the world done whipped him so. When you starts measuring somebody, measure him right child, measure him right. Make sure you done taken into account what hills and valleys he come through before he got to wherever he is.
quote360.author: Lorraine Hansberryfrom the play, Raisin in the Sun

quote361.quote: Love is the final end of the world's history, the Amen of the universe.
quote361.author: Novalis Hardenberg

quote362.quote: A lover without indiscretion is no lover at all. Circumspection and devotion are a contradiction in terms.
quote362.author: Thomas Hardy

quote363.quote: People need loving the most when they deserve it the least.
quote363.author: John Harrigan

quote364.quote: Love is misunderstood to be an emotion; actually, it is a state of awareness, a way of being in the world, a way of seeing oneself and others.
quote364.author: David R. Hawkins

quote365.quote: Love is the great miracle cure. Loving ourselves works miracles in our lives.
quote365.author: Louise L. Hay

quote366.quote: The story of a love is not important -- what is important is that one is capable of love. It is perhaps the only glimpse we are permitted of eternity.
quote366.author: Helen Hayes

quote367.quote: There is only one terminal dignity -- love.
quote367.author: Helen Hayes

quote368.quote: The love of liberty is the love of others; the love of power is the love of ourselves. We cannot force love.
quote368.author: William Hazlitt

quote369.quote: I do not think that what is called Love at first sight is so great an absurdity as it is sometimes imagined to be. We generally make up our minds beforehand to the sort of person we should like, grave or gay, black, brown, or fair; with golden tresses or raven locks; -- and when we meet with a complete example of the qualities we admire, the bargain is soon struck.
quote369.author: William Hazlitt

quote370.quote: One would always want to think of oneself as being on the side of love, ready to recognize it and wish it well --but, when confronted with it in others, one so often resented it, questioned its true nature, secretly dismissed the particular instance as folly or promiscuity. Was it merely jealousy, or a reluctance to admit so noble and enviable a sentiment in anyone but oneself?
quote370.author: Shirley Hazzard

quote371.quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.
quote371.author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote372.quote: Madame, it is an old word and each one takes it new and wears it out himself. It is a word that fills with meaning as a bladder with air and the meaning goes out of it as quickly. It may be punctured as a bladder is punctured and patched and blown up again and if you have not had it does not exist for you. All people talk of it, but those who have had it are marked by it, and I would not wish to speak of it further since of all things it is the most ridiculous to talk of and only fools go through it many times.
quote372.author: Ernest Hemingway

quote373.quote: Only the really plain people know about love --the very fascinating ones try so hard to create an impression that they very soon exhaust their talents.
quote373.author: Katharine Hepburn

quote374.quote: Love has nothing to do with what you are expecting to get--only with what you are expecting to give--which is everything.
quote374.author: Katharine Hepburn

quote375.quote: In the absence of love, there is nothing worth fighting for.
quote375.author: Elijah Wood

quote376.quote: For love... has two faces; one white, the other black; two bodies; one smooth, the other hairy. It has two hands, two feet, two tails, two, indeed, of every member and each one is the exact opposite of the other. Yet, so strictly are they joined together
quote376.author: Virginia Woolf

quote377.quote: A man falls in love through his eyes, a woman through her ears.
quote377.author: Woodrow Wyatt

quote378.quote: Mistresses are like books; if you pore upon them too much, they doze you and make you unfit for company; but if used discreetly, you are the fitter for conversation by em.
quote378.author: William Wycherley

quote379.quote: People who are sensible about love are incapable of it.
quote379.author: Douglas Yates

quote380.quote: A pity beyond all telling is hid in the heart of love.
quote380.author: William Butler Yeats

quote381.quote: Love the giver more than the gift.
quote381.author: Brigham Young

quote382.quote: You can't buy love, but you can pay heavily for it.
quote382.author: Henny Youngman

quote383.quote: When you interact with another, an illusion is part of this dynamic. This illusion allows each soul to perceive what it needs to understands in order to heal.
quote383.author: Gary Zukav

quote385.quote: To love without role, without power plays, is revolution.
quote385.author: Rita Mae Brown

quote386.quote: Love is the wild card of existence.
quote386.author: Rita Mae Brown

quote387.quote: How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.I love thee to the depth and breadth and heightMy soul can reach, when feeling out of sightFor the ends of Being and ideal Grace.I love thee to the level of every day'sMost quiet need; by sun and candle-light.I love thee freely, as men strive for Right;I love thee purely, as they turn from Praise.I love thee with the passion put to useIn my old griefs, and with my childhood's faithI love thee with a love I seemed to loseWith my lost saints,--I love thee with the breath.Smiles, tears, of all my life!--and, if God choose,I shall but love thee better after death.Elizabeth wrote this poem to Robert; Robert
quote387.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote388.quote: Who so loves believes the impossible.
quote388.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote389.quote: Never the time and the place and the loved one all together!
quote389.author: Robert Browning

quote390.quote: Grow old along with me!The best is yet to be,The last of life, for which the first was made:Our times are in his hand Who saith
quote390.author: Robert BrowningRabbi Ben Ezra

quote391.quote: We can recognize the dawn and the decline of love by the uneasiness we feel when alone together.
quote391.author: Jean De La Bruyere

quote392.quote: To be among people one loves, that's sufficient; to dream, to speak to them, to be silent among them, to think of indifferent things; but among them, everything is equal.
quote392.author: Jean De La Bruyere

quote393.quote: One seeks to make the loved one entirely happy, or, if that cannot be, entirely wretched.
quote393.author: Jean De La Bruyere

quote394.quote: When two people relate to each other authentically and humanly, God is the electricity that surges between them.
quote394.author: Martin Buber

quote396.quote: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.
quote396.author: Buddha

quote397.quote: Love the whole world as a mother lovers her only child.
quote397.author: Buddha

quote398.quote: Love thou the rose, yet leave it on its stem.
quote398.author: Edward George Bulwer-Lytton

quote399.quote: No cord nor cable can so forcibly draw, or hold so fast, as love can do with a twined thread.
quote399.author: Robert Burton

quote400.quote: Love is life. And if you miss love, you miss life.
quote400.author: Leo Buscaglia

quote401.quote: Love can never grow old. Locks may lose their brown and gold. Cheeks may fade and hollow grow. But the hearts that love will know, never winter's frost and chill, summer's warmth is in them still.
quote401.author: Leo Buscaglia

quote402.quote: Don't smother each other. No one can grow in the shade.
quote402.author: Leo Buscaglia

quote403.quote: Don't hold to anger, hurt or pain. They steal your energy and keep you from love.
quote403.author: Leo Buscaglia

quote404.quote: Perfect love is rare indeed - for to be a lover will require that you continually have the subtlety of the very wise, the flexibility of the child, the sensitivity of the artist, the understanding of the philosopher, the acceptance of the saint, the tolerance of the scholar and the fortitude of the certain.
quote404.author: Leo Buscaglia

quote405.quote: It is better to have loved and lost than never to have lost at all.
quote405.author: Samuel Butler

quote406.quote: Like the measles, love is most dangerous when it comes late in life.
quote406.author: Lord (George Gordon) Byron

quote407.quote: Man's love is of man's life a part; it is a woman's whole existence. In her first passion, a woman loves her lover, in all the others all she loves is love.
quote407.author: Lord (George Gordon) Byron

quote409.quote: Love and a cough cannot be hid.
quote409.author: George Herbert

quote410.quote: Those that embrace the entire universe with love, for the most part love nothing, but their narrow selves.
quote410.author: Johann Gottfried Von Herder

quote411.quote: Love is like a fruit. It may look good, but you shouldn't bite in it until it's ripe.
quote411.author: Nick Hertl

quote413.quote: Love is only the game that is not called on account of darkness.
quote413.author: Mangnu Hirschfield

quote414.quote: Love is a conflict between reflexes and reflections.
quote414.author: Mangnu Hirschfield

quote415.quote: Love is like pi -- natural, irrational, and very important.
quote415.author: Lisa Hoffman

quote416.quote: The choicest thing this world has for a man is affection.
quote416.author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

quote417.quote: Love is the master key which opens the gates of happiness.
quote417.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote418.quote: Where we love is home, home that our feet may leave, but not our hearts.
quote418.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote419.quote: Subdue your passion or it will subdue you.
quote419.author: Horace

quote420.quote: Love is seeing without eyes, hearing without ears; hatred is nothing.
quote420.author: Doug Horton

quote421.quote: If you love something let it go free. If it doesn't come back, you never had it. If it comes back, love it forever.
quote421.author: Doug Horton

quote422.quote: Love is a given, hatred is acquired.
quote422.author: Doug Horton

quote423.quote: If a woman doesn't chase a man a little, she doesn't love him.
quote423.author: Edward W. Howe

quote424.quote: Life in abundance comes only through great love.
quote424.author: Elbert Hubbard

quote425.quote: Lovers are fools, but Nature makes them so.
quote425.author: Elbert Hubbard

quote426.quote: The love we give away is the only love we keep.
quote426.author: Elbert Hubbard

quote427.quote: I met in the street a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, his cloak was out at the elbows, the water passed through his shoes -- and the stars through his soul.
quote427.author: Victor Hugo

quote428.quote: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.
quote428.author: Victor Hugo

quote429.quote: To love another person is to see the face of God. Les Miserables
quote429.author: Victor Hugo

quote430.quote: The supreme happiness in life is the conviction that we are loved -- loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
quote430.author: Victor Hugo

quote431.quote: The supreme happiness in life is the conviction that we are loved.
quote431.author: Victor Hugo

quote432.quote: Affection, like melancholy, magnifies trifles; but the magnifying of the one is like looking through a telescope at heavenly objects; that of the other, like enlarging monsters with a microscope.
quote432.author: Leigh Hunt

quote433.quote: Love, I find, is like singing. Everybody can do enough to satisfy themselves, though it may not impress the neighbors as being very much.
quote433.author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote434.quote: Where love is concerned, too much is not even enough.
quote434.author: Pierre De Beaumarchais

quote435.quote: When we understand that man is the only animal who must create meaning, who must open a wedge into neutral nature, we already understand the essence of love. Love is the problem of an animal who must find life, create a dialogue with nature in order to experience his own being.
quote435.author: Ernest Becker

quote436.quote: Young love is a flame; very pretty, often very hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. The love of the older and disciplined heart is as coals, deep-burning, unquenchable.
quote436.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote437.quote: Love is the river of life in the world.
quote437.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote438.quote: I never knew how to worship until I knew how to love.
quote438.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote439.quote: Love ceases to be a pleasure, when it ceases to be a secret.
quote439.author: Aphra Behn

quote441.quote: The opposite of love is not to hate but to separate. If love and hate have something in common it is because, in both cases, their energy is that of bringing and holding together
quote441.author: John BergerAnd Our Faces, My Heart, Brief as Photos, ch. 2, Pantheon (1984)

quote442.quote: Love seeks no cause beyond itself and no fruit; it is its own fruit, its own enjoyment. I love because I love; I love in order that I may love.
quote442.author: St. Bernard

quote443.quote: Let no one believe that he has received the divine kiss, if he knows the truth without loving it or loves it without understanding it. But blessed is that kiss whereby not only is God recognized but also the Father is loved; for there is never full knowledge without perfect love.
quote443.author: St. Bernard

quote444.quote: All the pictures that hung in my memory before I knew you have faded and given place to our radient moments together. Now I cannot live apart from you...Your words are my food, your breath my wine. You are everything to me.
quote444.author: Sarah Bernhardt

quote445.quote: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth. Colossians 3:2
quote445.author: Bible

quote446.quote: We know that we have passed from death into life, because we love... 1 John 3:14
quote446.author: Bible

quote447.quote: And this I pray, that your love may abound still more and more in real knowledge and all discernment. Philippians 1:9
quote447.author: Bible

quote448.quote: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
quote448.author: Bible

quote449.quote: This is my commandment, that ye love one another. Jesus, In John 15:12
quote449.author: Bible

quote450.quote: By this all men will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another. John 13:35
quote450.author: Bible

quote451.quote: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself. Roman 13:9
quote451.author: Bible

quote452.quote: He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love. I John
quote452.author: Bible

quote453.quote: Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings.
quote453.author: Bible

quote454.quote: Love is patient and kind; love is not jealous or boastful; it is not arrogant or rude. I Corinthians
quote454.author: Bible

quote455.quote: Love is the fulfilling of the Law.
quote455.author: Bible

quote456.quote: Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love. The Song Of Solomon 2:5
quote456.author: Bible

quote457.quote: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casts out fear.
quote457.author: Bible

quote458.quote: And you are to love those who are your aliens for you yourselves were aliens in Egypt. Deuteronomy 10:19
quote458.author: Bible

quote459.quote: Suddenly the ground seemed to give way beneath me,and I found myself in quite another region.Within five minutes I went throughsome such reflections as the following:the loneliness of the human soul is unendurable;nothing can penetrate it except the highest intensityof the sort of love that religious teachers have preached;whatever does not spring from this motive is harmful,or at best useless;it follows that war is wrong,that a public school education is abominable,that the use of force is to be deprecated,and that in human relations one should penetrateto the core of loneliness in each person and speak to that.
quote459.author: Bertrand RussellThe Autobiography of Bertrand Russell 1872-1914, p. 234.
