quote460.quote: To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already three parts dead.
quote460.author: Bertrand Russell

quote461.quote: Many people when they fall in love look for a little haven of refuge from the world, where they can be sure of being admired when they are not admirable, and praised when they are not praiseworthy.
quote461.author: Bertrand Russell

quote462.quote: The root of the matter the thing I mean is love, Christian love, or compassion. If you feel this, you have a motive for existence, a guide for action, a reason for courage, an imperative necessity for intellectual honesty.
quote462.author: Bertrand Russell

quote463.quote: Sure I love Goldie. How could you not love Goldie? Everyone loves Goldie. I love her, and I hope our love will continue, but I don't want to give an I-love-Goldie-Hawn interview.
quote463.author: Kurt Russell

quote464.quote: Every little girl knows about love. It is only her capacity to suffer because of it that increases.
quote464.author: Francoise Sagan

quote465.quote: Love, and do what thou wilt: whether thou hold thy peace, through love hold thy peace; whether thou cry out, through love cry out; whether thou correct, through love correct; whether thou spare, through love do thou spare: let the root of love be within, of this root can nothing spring but what is good.
quote465.author: Saint Augustine of Hippo

quote466.quote: What I needed most was to love and to be loved, eager to be caught. Happily I wrapped those painful bonds around me; and sure enough, I would be lashed with the red-hot pokers or jealousy, by suspicions and fear, by burst of anger and quarrels.
quote466.author: Saint Augustine of Hippo

quote467.quote: What does love look like? It has the hands to help others. It has the feet to hasten to the poor and needy. It has eyes to see misery and want. It has the ears to hear the sighs and sorrows of men. That is what love looks like.
quote467.author: Saint Augustine of Hippo

quote468.quote: God loves each of us as if there were only one of us.
quote468.author: Saint Augustine of Hippo

quote469.quote: Love consists not in feeling great things but in having great detachment and in suffering for the Beloved.
quote469.author: Saint John of the Cross

quote470.quote: In the evening of life, we will be judged on love alone.
quote470.author: Saint John of the Cross

quote471.quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.
quote471.author: Antoine De Saint-Exupery

quote472.quote: Love is not just looking at each other, it's looking in the same direction.
quote472.author: Antoine De Saint-Exupery

quote473.quote: For true love is inexhaustible; the more you give, the more you have. And if you go to draw at the true fountainhead, the more water you draw, the more abundant is its flow.
quote473.author: Antoine De Saint-Exupery

quote474.quote: Tell me who admires you and loves you, and I will tell you who you are.
quote474.author: Charles Augustin Sainte-Beuve

quote475.quote: It is better to have loved your wife than never to have loved at all.
quote475.author: Edgar Saltus

quote476.quote: I regard as a mortal sin not only the lying of the senses in matters of love, but also the illusion which the senses seek to create where love is only partial. I say, I believe, that one must love with all of one's being, or else live, come what may, a life of complete chastity.
quote476.author: George Sand

quote477.quote: The lover knows much more about absolute good and universal beauty than any logician or theologian, unless the latter, too, be lovers in disguise.
quote477.author: George Santayana

quote478.quote: Not to believe in love is a great sign of dullness. There are some people so indirect and lumbering that they think all real affection must rest on circumstantial evidence.
quote478.author: George Santayana

quote479.quote: It is the privilege of those who fear love to murder those who do not fear it!
quote479.author: May Sarton

quote480.quote: Everything comes to us from others. To Be is to belong to someone.
quote480.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote481.quote: I believe the greatest gift I can conceive of having from anyone is to be seen by them, heard by them, to be understood and touched by them.
quote481.author: Virginia Satir

quote482.quote: I love Brian Piccolo, and I'd like all of you to love him. When you hit your knees to pray tonight, please ask God to love him, too.
quote482.author: Gale SayersWords spoken in May 1970, as he accepted the NFL's Most Courageous Player award.

quote483.quote: Love is a spendthrift, leaves it arithmetic at home, is always in the red.
quote483.author: Paul Scherer

quote484.quote: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.
quote484.author: Robert Frost

quote485.quote: Love is staying up all night with a sick child -- or a healthy adult.
quote485.author: Sir David Paradine Frost

quote486.quote: Two persons love in one another the future good which they aid one another to unfold.
quote486.author: Margaret Fuller

quote487.quote: A coward is incapable of exhibiting love; it is the prerogative of the brave.
quote487.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote488.quote: My life is an indivisible whole, and all my attitudes run into one another; and they all have their rise in my insatiable love for mankind.
quote488.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote489.quote: Whenever you are confronted with an opponent. Conquer him with love.
quote489.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote490.quote: Nothing is impossible for pure love.
quote490.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote491.quote: Where there is love there is life.
quote491.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote492.quote: For it was not into my ear you whispered, but into my heart. It was not my lips you kissed, but my soul.
quote492.author: Judy Garland

quote493.quote: What then in love can woman do? If we grow fond they shun us. And when we fly them, they pursue: But leave us when they've won us.
quote493.author: John Gay

quote494.quote: The chemist who can extract from his heart's elements, compassion, respect, longing, patience, regret, surprise, and forgiveness and compound them into one can create that atom which is called love.
quote494.author: Kahlil Gibran

quote495.quote: Love gives naught but itself and takes naught but from itself. Love possesses not nor would it be possessed; For love is sufficient unto love.
quote495.author: Kahlil Gibran

quote496.quote: It is wrong to think that love comes from long companionship and persevering courtship. Love is the offspring of spiritual affinity and unless that affinity is created in a moment, it will not be created for years or even generations.
quote496.author: Kahlil Gibran

quote497.quote: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.
quote497.author: Kahlil Gibran

quote498.quote: Love possesses not nor will it be possessed, for love is sufficient unto love.
quote498.author: Kahlil Gibran

quote499.quote: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
quote499.author: Kahlil Gibran, "The Vision"

quote500.quote: The weight of the world is love. Under the burden of solitude, under the burden of dissatisfaction.
quote500.author: Allen Ginsberg

quote501.quote: Love is the irresistible desire to be desired irresistibly.
quote501.author: Louis Ginsberg

quote502.quote: We love because it's the only true adventure.
quote502.author: Nikki Giovanni

quote503.quote: We are shaped and fashioned by what whom we love.
quote503.author: Johann von Goethe

quote504.quote: If I love you, what business is it of yours?
quote504.author: Johann von Goethe

quote505.quote: Love is an ideal thing, marriage a real thing; a confusion of the real with the ideal never goes unpunished.
quote505.author: Johann von Goethe

quote506.quote: That is the true season of love; when we believe that we alone can love, that no one could ever have loved as much before, and that no one will ever love in the same way again.
quote506.author: Johann von Goethe

quote507.quote: Today I begin to understand what love must be, if it exists. When we are parted, we each feel the lack of the other half of ourselves. We are incomplete like a book in two volumes of which the first has been lost. That is what I imagine love to be: incompleteness in absence.
quote507.author: Edmond de Goncourt

quote508.quote: Love is not blind -- it sees more, not less. But because it sees more, it is willing to see less.
quote508.author: Rabbi J. Gordon

quote509.quote: Dive deep, O mind, dive deep in the ocean of God's beauty! If you descend to the uttermost depths, there you will find the gem of love.
quote509.author: Bengali Hymn

quote510.quote: Love is the only bow of life's dark cloud. It is the Morning and Evening Star. It shines upon the cradle of the babe, and sheds its radiance upon the quiet tomb. It is the Mother of Art, inspirer of poet, patriot, and philosopher. It is the air and light of every heart, builder of every home, kinder of every fire on every hearth, It was the first dream of immortality. It fills the world with melody. Love is the magician, the enchanter, that changes worthless things to joy, and makes right royal kings of common clay.
quote510.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote511.quote: I would rather live and love where death is king than have eternal life where love is not.
quote511.author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote512.quote: A woman's life is a history of the affections.
quote512.author: Washington Irving

quote513.quote: Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart.
quote513.author: Washington Irving

quote514.quote: Love is the total absence of fear. Love asks no questions. Its natural state is one of extension and expansion, not comparison and measurement.
quote514.author: Gerald G. Jampolsky

quote515.quote: Love can sometimes be magic. But magic can sometimes...just be an illusion.
quote515.author: Javan

quote516.quote: Nothing is more beautiful than the love that has weathered the storms of life. The love of the young for the young, that is the beginning of life. But the love of the old for the old, that is the beginning of things longer.
quote516.author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote517.quote: Love is not to be purchased, and affection has no price.
quote517.author: St. Jerome

quote518.quote: Love's like the measles; all the worse when it comes late in life.
quote518.author: Douglas William Jerrold

quote519.quote: Love, you are eternal like springtime.
quote519.author: Juan Ramon Jiminez

quote520.quote: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.
quote520.author: Samuel Johnson

quote521.quote: Love doesn't make the world go round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
quote521.author: Franklin P. Jones

quote523.quote: Paradoxically, we fail to disclose ourselves to other people because we want so much to be loved. Because we feel that way we present ourselves as someone we think can be loved and accepted, and we conceal whatever would mar that image. Another reason we hide is to protect ourselves from change. . . Still another reason we don't disclose ourselves is that we were never taught how. . . Personal ambitions and economic pressures also give us powerful reasons for concealing what we really are. . . All of us hide behind the iron curtain of our public selves. . . Men hide what prevents them from seeming strong and masculine. . . Disclosure is so important (because) without it we really cannot know ourselves. Or to put it another way, we learn to deceive ourselves while we are trying to deceive others. For example, if I never express my sorrow, my love, my joy, I'll smother those feelings in myself until I almost forget they were once part of me.
quote523.author: Sidney Jourard

quote525.quote: Perhaps the most important reason for self-disclosure is that without it we cannot truly love.
quote525.author: Sidney Jourard, "Redbook", October, 1971

quote526.quote: Love (understood as the desire of good for another) is in fact so unnatural a phenomenon that it can scarcely repeat itself, the soul being unable to become virgin again and not having energy enough to cast itself out again into the ocean of another's soul.
quote526.author: James Joyce

quote527.quote: Love is as much of an object as an obsession, everybody wants it, everybody seeks it, but few ever achieve it, those who do will cherish it, be lost in it, and among all, never... never forget it.
quote527.author: Curtis Judalet

quote528.quote: Where love rules, there is no will to power; where power predominates, there love is lacking. The one is the shadow of the other.
quote528.author: Carl Gustav Jung

quote529.quote: Love in marriage should be the accomplishment of a beautiful dream, and not, as it too often is, the end.
quote529.author: Alphonse Karr

quote530.quote: I cannot exist without you - I am forgetful of every thing but seeing you again - my Life seems to stop there - I see no further. You have absorb'd me. I have a sensation at the present moment as though I were dissolving... I have been astonished that Men could die Martyrs for religion - I have shudder'd at it - I shudder no more - I could be martyr'd for my Religion - Love is my religion - I could die for that - I could die for you. My creed is Love and you are its only tenet - You have ravish'd me away by a Power I cannot resist.
quote530.author: John Keats

quote531.quote: How sweet it is to love, and to be dissolved, and as it were to bathe myself in thy love.
quote531.author: Thomas Kempis

quote532.quote: Love feels no burden, thinks nothing of trouble, attempts what is above its strength.... It is therefore able to undertake all things, and it completes many things, and warrants them to take effect, where he who does not love would faint and lie down.
quote532.author: Thomas Kempis

quote533.quote: Love feels no burden, regards not labors, strives toward more than it attains, argues not of impossibility, since it believes that it may and can do all things. Therefore it avails for all things, and fulfils and accomplishes much where one not a lover falls and lies helpless.
quote533.author: Thomas Kempis

quote534.quote: He who is in love is wise and is becoming wiser, sees newly every time he looks at the object beloved, drawing from it with his eyes and his mind those virtues which it possesses.
quote534.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote535.quote: We don't believe in rheumatism and true love until after the first attack.
quote535.author: Marie E. Eschenbach

quote536.quote: We always come back to our first love.
quote536.author: Etienne

quote537.quote: Love is all we have, the only way that each can help the other.
quote537.author: Euripides

quote538.quote: He is not a lover who does not love forever.
quote538.author: Euripides

quote539.quote: The hardest of all is learning to be a well of affection, and not a fountain; to show them we love them not when we feel like it, but when they do.
quote539.author: Nan Fairbrother

quote540.quote: People love others not for who they are, but for how they make them feel.
quote540.author: Irwin Federman

quote541.quote: You talk too much, you laugh too loud, that's the price of love.
quote541.author: Brian Ferry

quote542.quote: A lover, when he is admitted to cards, ought to be solemnly silent, and observe the motions of his mistress. He must laugh when she laughs, sigh when she sighs. In short, he should be the shadow of her mind. A lady, in the presence of her lover, should never want a looking-glass; as a beau, in the presence of his looking-glass, never wants a mistress.
quote542.author: Henry Fielding

quote543.quote: I don't want to live -- I want to love first, and live incidentally.
quote543.author: Zelda Fitzgerald

quote544.quote: You couldn't get a clue during the clue mating season in a field full of horny clues if you smeared your body with clue musk and did the clue mating dance.
quote544.author: Edward Flaherty

quote545.quote: Oh love will make a dog howl in rhyme.
quote545.author: John FletcherQueen of Corinth

quote546.quote: The idea that nations should love one another, or that business concerns or marketing boards should love one another, or that a man in Portugal should love a man in Peru of whom he has never heard --it is absurd, unreal, dangerous. The fact is we can only love what we know personally. And we cannot know much.
quote546.author: E. M. Forster

quote547.quote: It makes no difference how deeply seated may be the trouble, how hopeless the outlook, how muddled the tangle, how great the mistake. A sufficient realization of love will dissolve it all.
quote547.author: Emmet Fox

quote548.quote: If you could only love enough, you could be the most powerful person in the world.
quote548.author: Emmet Fox

quote549.quote: Lovers who love truly do not write down their happiness.
quote549.author: Anatole France

quote550.quote: Well, love is insanity. The ancient Greeks knew that. It is the taking over of a rational and lucid mind by delusion and self-destruction. You lose yourself, you have no power over yourself, you can't even think straight.
quote550.author: Marilyn French

quote551.quote: We are never so defenseless against suffering as when we love, never so forlornly unhappy as when we have lost our love object or its love.
quote551.author: Sigmund Freud

quote552.quote: One is very crazy when in love.
quote552.author: Sigmund Freud

quote553.quote: Love and work are the cornerstones of our humanness.
quote553.author: Sigmund Freud

quote554.quote: Love, while you are able to love.
quote554.author: A. Frieligrath

quote555.quote: Love is often nothing but a favorable exchange between two people who get the most of what they can expect, considering their value on the personality market.
quote555.author: Erich Fromm

quote556.quote: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.
quote556.author: Erich Fromm

quote557.quote: In love the paradox occurs that two beings become one and yet remain two.
quote557.author: Erich Fromm

quote558.quote: Immature love says: 'I love you because I need you.' Mature love says 'I need you because I love you.'
quote558.author: Erich Fromm

quote559.author: Friedrich von SchillerPhilosophical Letters, Vol. III pp 210-211

quote560.quote: Perhaps the old monks were right when they tried to root love out; perhaps the poets are right when they try to water it. It is a blood-red flower, with the color of sin; but there is always the scent of a god about it.
quote560.author: Olive Schreiner

quote561.quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.
quote561.author: Charles Monroe Schulz

quote562.quote: Love... Force it and it disappears. You cannot will love, nor even control it. You can only guide its expression. It comes or it goes according to those qualities in life that invite it or deny its presence.
quote562.author: David Seabury

quote563.quote: Love means never having to say you're sorry.
quote563.author: Erich Segal

quote564.quote: True love comes quietly, without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells, get your ears checked.
quote564.author: Erich Segal

quote565.quote: Those whom true love has held, it will go on holding.
quote565.author: Seneca (Seneca the Elder)

quote566.quote: If you wish to be loved; Love!
quote566.author: Seneca (Seneca the Elder)

quote567.quote: I believe love produces a certain flowering of the whole personality which nothing else can achieve.
quote567.author: Ivan Sergeevich

quote568.quote: The only thing bigger than God`s great universe is man`s ego.
quote568.author: Gary Sevakis

quote569.quote: Every man loves what he is good at.
quote569.author: Thomas Shadwell

quote570.quote: O Romeo, Romeo! wherefore art thou Romeo? Deny thy father and refuse thy name; Or, if thou wilt not, be but sworn my love... 'Tis but thy name that is my enemy;What's in a name? that which we call a rose By any other name would smell as sweet...
quote570.author: William ShakespeareRomeo and Juliet, Act II, Scene II

quote571.quote: Love sought is good, but given unsought is better.
quote571.author: William Shakespeare

quote572.quote: When love begins to sicken and decay it uses an enforced ceremony. Julius Caesar
quote572.author: William Shakespeare

quote573.quote: To say the truth, reason and love keep little company together now-a-days.
quote573.author: William Shakespeare

quote574.quote: They do not love that do not show their love. The course of true love never did run smooth. Love is a familiar. Love is a devil. There is no evil angel but Love.
quote574.author: William Shakespeare

quote575.quote: Love is too young to know what conscience is.
quote575.author: William Shakespeare

quote576.quote: Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs. Being purged, a fire sparkling in lovers eyes. Being vexed, a sea nourished with lovers tears. What is it else? A madness most discreet, a choking gall and a preserving sweet.
quote576.author: William Shakespeare

quote577.quote: Men have died from time to time, and worms have eaten them, but not for love.
quote577.author: William Shakespeare

quote578.quote: But love is blind, and lovers cannot see What petty follies they themselves commit
quote578.author: William Shakespeare

quote579.quote: Love bears it out even to the edge of doom.
quote579.author: William Shakespeare

quote580.quote: She's gone. I am abused, and my relief must be to loathe her.
quote580.author: William Shakespeare

quote581.quote: We that are true lovers run into strange capers.
quote581.author: William Shakespeare

quote582.quote: Loving can cost a lot but not loving always costs more, and those who fear to love often find that want of love is an emptiness that robs the joy from life.
quote582.author: Merle Shan

quote583.quote: If you value a man's regard, strive with him. As to liking, you like your newspaper -- and despise it.
quote583.author: George Bernard Shaw

quote584.quote: What force is more potent than love?
quote584.author: Igor Stravinsky

quote585.quote: Is it not by love alone that we succeed in penetrating to the very essence of being?
quote585.author: Igor Stravinsky

quote586.quote: I hated her now with a hatred more fatal than indifference because it was the other side of love.
quote586.author: J. August Strindberg

quote587.quote: To fall in love is easy, even to remain in it is not difficult; our human loneliness is cause enough. But it is a hard quest worth making to find a comrade through whose steady presence one becomes steadily the person one desires to be.
quote587.author: Anna Louise Strong

quote588.quote: To love is to receive a glimpse of heaven.
quote588.author: Karen Sunde

quote589.quote: As love without esteem is capricious and volatile; esteem without love is languid and cold.
quote589.author: Jonathan Swift

quote590.quote: We often speak of love when we really should be speaking of the drive to dominate or to master, so as to confirm ourselves as active agents, in control of our own destinies and worthy of respect from others.
quote590.author: Thomas Szasz

quote591.quote: Love's overbrimming mystery joins death and life. It has filled my cup of pain with joy.
quote591.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote592.quote: We live in the world when we love it.
quote592.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote593.quote: Together, we'll live with the sadness. I'll love you with all the madness in my soul.
quote593.author: Koushun Takami

quote594.quote: For where there is true love, a man is neither out of measure lifted up by prosperity, nor cast down by mishap; whether you give or take away from him, so long as he keeps his beloved, he has a spring of inward peace. Thus, even though thy outward man grieve, or weep downright, that may well be borne, if only thy inner man remain at peace, perfectly content with the will of God.
quote594.author: Johannes Tauler

quote595.quote: No one worth possessing can be quite possessed.
quote595.author: Sara Teasdale

quote596.quote: A life without love in it is like a heap of ashes upon a deserted hearth, with the fire dead, the laughter stilled and the light extinguished.
quote596.author: Frank Tebbets

quote597.quote: I hold it true, whatever befall; I feel it, when I sorrow most; 'Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all.
quote597.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote599.quote: Who is wise in love, love most, say least.
quote599.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote600.quote: It is here, my daughters, that love is to be found -- not hidden away in corners but in the midst of occasions of sin. And believe me, although we may more often fail and commit small lapses, our gain will be incomparably the greater.
quote600.author: Teresa of Avila

quote601.quote: True love grows by sacrifice and the more thoroughly the soul rejects natural satisfaction the stronger and more detached its tenderness becomes.
quote601.author: St. Theresa of Lisieux

quote602.quote: There is no remedy for love than to love more.
quote602.author: Henry David Thoreau

quote603.quote: Love must be as much a light, as it is a flame.
quote603.author: Henry David Thoreau

quote604.quote: Love is the strange bewilderment that overtakes one person on account of another person.
quote604.author: James Thurber

quote605.quote: Love is what you've been through with somebody.
quote605.author: James Thurber

quote606.quote: Love is life. All, everything that I understand, I understand only because I love. Everything is, everything exists, only because I love. Everything is united by it alone. Love is God, and to die means that I, a particle of love, shall return to the general and eternal source.
quote606.author: Leo Tolstoy

quote607.quote: All, everything that I understand, I understand only because I love.
quote607.author: Leo Tolstoy

quote608.quote: If love is the answer, could you please rephrase the question?
quote608.author: Lily Tomlin

quote609.quote: The fickleness of the women I love is only equaled by the infernal constancy of the women who love me.
quote609.author: George Bernard Shaw

quote610.quote: First love is only a little foolishness and a lot of curiosity: no really self-respecting woman would take advantage of it.
quote610.author: George Bernard Shaw

quote611.quote: All love is sweet, Given or returned. Common as light is love, And its familiar voice wearies not ever. They who inspire is most are fortunate, As I am now: but those who feel it most Are happier still.
quote611.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote612.quote: Love is free; to promise for ever to love the same woman is not less absurd than to promise to believe the same creed; such a vow in both cases excludes us from all inquiry.
quote612.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote613.quote: Woe is me! The winged words on which my soul would pierceInto the heights of love's rare universe,Are chains of lead around its flight of fire--I pant, I sink, I tremble, I expire.
quote613.author: Percy Bysshe ShelleyEpipsychidion (1821)

quote614.quote: All fair in love and war.
quote614.author: Francis Edward Smedley

quote615.quote: Love is but the discovery of ourselves in others, and the delight in the recognition.
quote615.author: Alexander Smith

quote616.quote: A slight touch of friendly malice and amusement towards those we love keeps our affections for them from turning flat.
quote616.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote617.quote: To love and be loved is the great happiness of existence.
quote617.author: Sydney Smith

quote618.quote: Love is not a matter of counting the years -- it's making the years count.
quote618.author: Wolfman Jack Smith

quote619.quote: The hottest love has the coldest end.
quote619.author: Socrates

quote620.quote: I pray Thee, O God, that I may be beautiful within.
quote620.author: Socrates

quote621.quote: When desire, having rejected reason and overpowered judgment which leads to right, is set in the direction of the pleasure which beauty can inspire, and when again under the influence of its kindred desires it is moved with violent motion towards the beauty of corporeal forms, it acquires a surname from this very violent motion, and is called love.
quote621.author: Socrates

quote622.quote: One should never direct people towards happiness, because happiness too is an idol of the market-place. One should direct them towards mutual affection. A beast gnawing at its prey can be happy too, but only human beings can feel affection for each other, and this is the highest achievement they can aspire to.
quote622.author: Alexandr Solzhenitsyn

quote623.quote: One word frees us of all the weight and pain of life; that word is love.
quote623.author: Sophocles

quote624.quote: What will not woman, gentle woman dare; when strong affection stirs her spirit up?
quote624.author: Robert Southey

quote625.quote: Love is life's end, but never ending. Love is life's wealth, never spent, but ever spending. Love's life's reward, rewarded in rewarding.
quote625.author: Herbert Spencer

quote626.quote: Love is the emblem of eternity; it confounds all notion of time; effaces all memory of a beginning, all fear of an end.
quote626.author: Germaine De Stael

quote627.quote: We cease loving ourselves if no one loves us.
quote627.author: Germaine De Stael

quote628.quote: Love the art in yourself and not yourself in the art.
quote628.author: Konstantin Stanislavisky

quote629.quote: Love wholeheartedly, be surprised, give thanks and praise then you will discover the fullness of your life.
quote629.author: David Steindl-Rast

quote630.quote: A very small degree of hope is sufficient to cause the birth of love.
quote630.author: Stendhal (Marie-Henri Beyle)

quote631.quote: True love makes the thought of death frequent, easy, without terrors; it merely becomes the standard of comparison, the price one would pay for many things.
quote631.author: Henri B. Stendhal

quote632.quote: In love, unlike most other passions, the recollection of what you have had and lost is always better than what you can hope for in the future.
quote632.author: Henri B. Stendhal

quote634.quote: Love is shown in your deeds, not in your words.
quote634.author: Fr. Jerome Cummings

quote635.quote: But it is impossible to replace a person one has loved with distractions.
quote635.author: Roald Dahl

quote636.quote: Another kind of love and compassion is not based on something appearing beautiful or nice, but based on the fact that the other person, just like oneself, wants happiness and does not want suffering and indeed has every right to be happy and to overcome suffering. On such a basis, we feel a sense of responsibility, a sense of closeness toward that being. That is true compassion. This is because the compassion is based on reason, notjust on emotional feeling. As a consequence, it does not matter what the other's attitude is, whether negative, or positive. What matters is that it is a human being, a sentient being that has the experience of pain and pleasure. There is no reason not to feel compassion so long as it is a sentient being.
quote636.author: Dalai LamaThe Dalai Lama, A Policy of Kindness

quote637.quote: The way to a woman's heart is through your wallet.
quote637.author: Frank Dane

quote638.quote: It is better to have loved and lost, than to have paid for it and not liked it at all.
quote638.author: Graham Davies

quote639.quote: If we seek the pleasures of love, passion should be occasional, and common sense continual.
quote639.author: Robertson Davies

quote640.quote: Love is not enough. It must be the foundation, the cornerstone -- but not the complete structure. It is much too pliable, too yielding.
quote640.author: Bette Davis

quote641.quote: The more connections you and your lover make, not just between your bodies, but between your minds, your hearts, and your souls, the more you will strengthen the fabric of your relationship, and the more real moments you will experience together.
quote641.author: Barbara De Angelis

quote642.quote: Love is a force more formidable than any other. It is invisible -- it cannot be seen or measured, yet it is powerful enough to transform you in a moment, and offer you more joy than any material possession could.
quote642.author: Barbara De Angelis

quote643.quote: Love's greatest gift is its ability to make everything it touches sacred.
quote643.author: Barbara De Angelis

quote644.quote: Absence is to love what wind is to fire; it extinguishes the small, it enkindles the great.
quote644.author: Comte DeBussy-Rabutin

quote645.quote: Love comes from blindness, friendship from knowledge.
quote645.author: Comte DeBussy-Rabutin

quote646.quote: Love builds bridges where there are none.
quote646.author: R. H. Delaney

quote647.quote: Love makes the wildest spirit tame, and the tamest spirit wild.
quote647.author: Alexis Delp

quote648.quote: Do everything with so much love in your heart that you would never want to do it any other way.
quote648.author: Yogi Desai

quote649.quote: Love is an ocean of emotions entirely surrounded by expenses.
quote649.author: Lord Thomas Dewar

quote650.quote: Yes, I do touch. I believe that everyone needs that
quote650.author: Princess of Wales Diana

quote651.quote: I love to hold people's hands when I visit hospitals, even though they are shocked because they haven't experienced anything like it before, but to me it is a normal thing to do.
quote651.author: Princess of Wales Diana

quote652.quote: I remember when I used to sit on hospital beds and hold people?s hands, people used to be shocked because they?d never seen this before. To me it was quite normal.
quote652.author: Princess of Wales Diana

quote653.quote: My first thoughts are that I should not let people down, that I should support them and love them.
quote653.author: Princess of Wales Diana

quote654.quote: If you find someone you love in your life, then hang on to that love.
quote654.author: Princess of Wales Diana

quote655.quote: I know that I can give love for a minute, for half an hour; for a day, for a month, but I can give and I'm very happy to do that and I want to do that.
quote655.author: Princess of Wales Diana

quote656.quote: I adore him I have never been so happy. I have real love.
quote656.author: Princess of Wales Diana

quote657.quote: Everyone of us needs to show how much we care for each other and, in the process, care for ourselves.
quote657.author: Princess of Wales Diana

quote658.quote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
quote658.author: Charles Dickens

quote659.quote: A temporary insanity curable by marriage.
quote659.author: Ambrose Bierce

quote660.quote: Love is said to be blind, but I know some fellows in love who can see twice as much in their sweethearts as I do.
quote660.author: Josh Billings

quote661.quote: True love is night jasmine, a diamond in darkness, the heartbeat no cardiologist has ever heard. It is the most common of miracles, fashioned of fleecy clouds -- a handful of stars tossed into the night sky.
quote661.author: Jim Bishop

quote662.quote: Love seeketh not itself to please, nor for itself hath any care, but for another gives its ease, and builds a Heaven in Hell's despair.
quote662.author: William Blake

quote663.quote: Love is the immortal flow of energy that nourishes, extends and preserves. Its eternal goal is life.
quote663.author: Smiley Blanton

quote664.quote: Love matches are made by people who are content, for a month of honey, to condemn themselves to a life of vinegar.
quote664.author: Marguerite Blessington

quote665.quote: Who can give law to lovers? Love is a greater law to itself.
quote665.author: Boethius (Anicius Manlius Severinus)De Consolatione Philosophiae

quote666.quote: As for me, to love you alone, to make you happy, to do nothing which would contradict your wishes, this is my destiny and the meaning of my life.
quote666.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote667.quote: The only victory over love is flight.
quote667.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote668.quote: To fall in love is to create a religion that has a fallible god.
quote668.author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote669.quote: The more familiar two people become, the more the language they speak together departs from that of the ordinary, dictionary-defined discourse. Familiarity creates a new language, an in-house language of intimacy that carries reference to the story the two lovers are weaving together and that cannot be readily understood by others.
quote669.author: Alain de BottonOn Love

quote670.quote: ...if the beginnings of love and amorous politics are equally rosy, then the ends may be equally bloody.
quote670.author: Alain de BottonOn Love

quote671.quote: A proof that experience is of no use, is that the end of one love does not prevent us from beginning another.
quote671.author: Paul Bourget

quote672.quote: When you love someone all your saved-up wishes start coming out.
quote672.author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote673.quote: Pity the selfishness of lovers: it is brief, a forlorn hope; it is impossible.
quote673.author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote674.quote: When once estrangement has arisen between those who truly love each other, everything seems to widen the breach.
quote674.author: Mary Elizabeth Braddon

quote675.quote: If I place love above everything, it is because for me it is the most desperate, the most despairing state of affairs imaginable.
quote675.author: Andre Breton

quote676.quote: When first we met we did not guess that Love would prove so hard a master.
quote676.author: Robert Bridges

quote677.quote: When Death to either shall come -- I pray it be first to me.
quote677.author: Robert Bridges

quote678.quote: Infinite hungers leap no more I in the chance swaying of your dress; and love has changed to kindliness.
quote678.author: Rupert Brooke

quote679.quote: All the little emptiness of love!
quote679.author: Rupert Brooke

quote680.quote: Real love is a pilgrimage. It happens when there is no strategy, but it is very rare because most people are strategists.
quote680.author: Anita Brookner

quote681.quote: Love comes when manipulation stops; when you think more about the other person than about his or her reactions to you. When you dare to reveal yourself fully. When you dare to be vulnerable.
quote681.author: Joyce Brothers

quote682.quote: The best proof of love is trust.
quote682.author: Joyce Brothers

quote683.quote: Sometimes the heart sees what is invisible to the eye.
quote683.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quote684.quote: He who is not impatient is not in love.
quote684.author: Italian Proverb

quote685.quote: Who travels for love finds a thousand miles not longer than one.
quote685.author: Japanese Proverb

quote686.quote: A man in love mistakes a pimple for a dimple.
quote686.author: Japanese Proverb

quote687.quote: It is easier to guard a sack full of fleas than a girl in love.
quote687.author: Yiddish Proverb

quote688.quote: He that plants trees loves others besides himself.
quote688.author: English Proverb

quote689.quote: You don't love a woman because she is beautiful, but she is beautiful because you love her.
quote689.author: Anon.

quote690.quote: If you love somebody, let them go. If they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.
quote690.author: Anon.

quote691.quote: Love has nothing to do with what you are expecting to get, it's what you are expected to give -- which is everything.
quote691.author: Anon.

quote692.quote: In love, there is always one who kisses and one who offers the cheek.
quote692.author: Proverb

quote693.quote: A heart that loves is always young.
quote693.author: Proverb

quote694.quote: It is easy to halve the potato where there is love.
quote694.author: Proverb

quote696.quote: Love rules his kingdom without a sword.
quote696.author: Proverb

quote697.quote: Follow love and it will flee, flee love and it will follow.
quote697.author: Proverb

quote698.quote: Love can neither be bought or sold, its only price is love.
quote698.author: Proverb

quote699.quote: Blue eyes say, Love me or I die; black eyes say, Love me or I kill thee.
quote699.author: Proverb

quote700.quote: All my life I have had a choice of hate and love. I chose love and I am here.
quote700.author: A.R. RahmanAcademy Award acceptance.

quote701.quote: Everyone admits that love is wonderful and necessary, yet no one agrees on just what it is.
quote701.author: Diane Ackerman

quote702.quote: There is a law that man should love his neighbor as himself. In a few hundred years it should be as natural to mankind as breathing or the upright gait; but if he does not learn it he must perish.
quote702.author: Alfred Adler

quote703.quote: And, oh, how blessed is it thus to meet! To feel that vanished years have not estranged us,distance has not diminished love, that we are to each other even as we parted; to feel again the fond kiss, to hear once more the accents of a voice which to us has been for years so still,--a voice that brings with it the gush of memory! Past days flit before us; feelings, thoughts, hopes, we deemed were dead, all rise again, summoned by that secret witchery, the well-remembered though long silent voice. Let years, long, lingering, saddening years drag on their chain, let youth have given place to manhood, manhood to age, still will it be the same--the voice we once have loved, and deemed to us for ever still--oh, time, and grief, and blighted hope will be forgotten, and youth, in its undimmed and joyous beauty, its glow of generous feelings, its bright anticipations, all, all again be ours. | -Grace AguilarThe Mother's Recompense, Volume II, 1859

quote704.quote: Are you ready to cut off your head and place your foot on it? If so, come; Love awaits you! Love is not grown in a garden, nor sold in the marketplace; whether you are a king or a servant, the price is your head, and nothing less. Yes, the cost of the elixir of love is your head! Do you hesitate? 0 miser, It is cheap at that price!
quote704.author: Abu Hamid Al-Ghazzali

quote706.quote: The Impossible Generalized Man today is the critic who believes in loving those unworthy of love as well as those worthy --yet believes this only insofar as no personal risk is entailed. Meaning he loves no one, worthy or no. This is what makes him impossible.
quote706.author: Nelson Algren

quote707.quote: I was nauseous and tingly all over. I was either in love or I had smallpox.
quote707.author: Woody Allen

quote708.quote: Sex alleviates tension. Love causes it.
quote708.author: Woody Allen

quote709.quote: For a crowd is not company; and faces are but a gallery of pictures; and talk but a tinkling cymbal, where there is no love.
quote709.author: Francis Bacon

quote710.quote: Nuptial love makes mankind; friendly love perfects it; but wanton love corrupts and debases it.
quote710.author: Francis Bacon

quote711.quote: What the world really needs is more love and less paper work.
quote711.author: Pearl Bailey

quote712.quote: The sweetest joy, the wildest woe is love.
quote712.author: Pearl Bailey

quote713.quote: Looking back, I have this to regret, that too often when I loved, I did not say so.
quote713.author: Ray Stannard Baker David Grayson

quote714.quote: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
quote714.author: James Baldwin

quote715.quote: Love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.
quote715.author: James Baldwin

quote716.quote: The motto of chivalry is also the motto of wisdom; to serve all, but love only one.
quote716.author: Honore de Balzac

quote717.quote: Do you want to know a good way to fall in love? Just associate with all your pleasant experiences with someone, and disassociate from all the unpleasant ones.
quote717.author: Richard Bandler

quote718.quote: I leave before being left. I decide.
quote718.author: Brigitte Bardot

quote719.quote: Love is just a system for getting someone to call you darling after sex.
quote719.author: Julian Barnes

quote720.quote: The advantage of love at first sight is that it delays a second sight.
quote720.author: Natalie Clifford Barney

quote721.quote: Lovers should also have their days off.
quote721.author: Natalie Clifford Barney

quote722.quote: The fate of love is that it always seems too little or too much.
quote722.author: Amelia E. Barr

quote723.quote: If you have it Love, you don't need to have anything else, and if you don't have it, it doesn't matter much what else you have.
quote723.author: James Barrie

quote724.quote: If it is your time, love will track you down like a cruise missile.
quote724.author: Lynda Barry

quote725.quote: Love is the delightful interval between meeting a beautiful girl and discovering that she looks like a haddock.
quote725.author: John Barrymore

quote726.quote: To try to write love is to confront the muck of language: that region of hysteria where language is both too much and too little, excessive and impoverished.
quote726.author: Roland Barthes

quote727.quote: Naturally, love's the most distant possibility.
quote727.author: Georges Bataille

quote728.quote: The greatest weakness of most humans is their hesitancy to tell others how much they love them while they're still alive.
quote728.author: Orlando A. Battista

quote729.quote: It is unfortunately very true that, without leisure and money, love can be no more than an orgy of the common man. Instead of being a sudden impulse full of ardor and reverie, it becomes a distastefully utilitarian affair.
quote729.author: Charles Baudelaire

quote730.quote: The lover of life makes the whole world into his family, just as the lover of the fair sex creates his from all the lovely women he has found, from those that could be found, and those who are impossible to find.
quote730.author: Charles Baudelaire

quote731.quote: To love someone is to isolate him from the world, wipe out every trace of him, dispossess him of his shadow, drag him into a murderous future. It is to circle around the other like a dead star and absorb him into a black light.
quote731.author: Jean Baudrillard

quote732.quote: If you say, I love you, then you have already fallen in love with language, which is already a form of break up and infidelity.
quote732.author: Jean Baudrillard

quote733.quote: There exists, between people in love, a kind of capital held by each. This is not just a stock of affects or pleasure, but also the possibility of playing double or quits with the share you hold in the other's heart.
quote733.author: Jean Baudrillard

quote734.quote: I argue thee that love is life. And life hath immortality.
quote734.author: Emily Dickinson

quote735.quote: Who dares deny that this is true: The whole is more than all its parts?A whole love than divided love,Or than half love from fifty hearts?Yet who dare either this deny:The part is more than is the whole?That treasures halved with one dear loveAre more than double to the soul?
quote735.author: Arthur Dillon

quote736.quote: For in the end, we will conserve only what we love. We will love only what we understand. We will understand only what we are taught.
quote736.author: Baba Dioum

quote737.quote: I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I have ever known.
quote737.author: Walt Disney

quote738.quote: The magic of first love is our ignorance that it can never end.
quote738.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote739.quote: We are all born for love. It is the principle of existence, and its only end.
quote739.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote740.quote: Come live with me, and be my love,And we will some new pleasures proveOf golden sands, and crystal brooks,With silken lines, and silver hooks.
quote740.author: John Donne, "The Bait"

quote741.quote: Love, all alike, no season knows, nor clime, nor hours, days, months, which are the rags of time.
quote741.author: John Donne

quote742.quote: Love built on beauty, soon as beauty, dies.
quote742.author: John Donne

quote743.quote: Love was as subtly caught, as a disease; But being got it is a treasure sweet, which to defend is harder than to get: And ought not be profaned on either part, for though 'Tis got by chance, 'Tis kept by art.
quote743.author: John Donne

quote744.quote: Busy old fool, unruly Sun, why dost thou thus through windows and through curtains call on us? Must to thy motions lovers seasons run?
quote744.author: John Donne

quote745.quote: To fail to love is not to exist at all.
quote745.author: Mark Van Doren

quote746.quote: Love all that has been created by God, both the whole and every grain of sand. Love every leaf and every ray of light. Love the beasts and the birds, love the plants, love every separate fragment. If you love each fragment, you will understand the mystery of the whole resting in God.
quote746.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote747.quote: Love is a ocean of emotions entirely surrounded by expenses.
quote747.author: Lord Drewar

quote748.quote: On the last analysis, then, love is life. Love never faileth and life never faileth so long as there is love.
quote748.author: Henry Drummond

quote749.quote: To love abundantly is to live abundantly, and to love forever is to live forever.
quote749.author: Henry Drummond

quote750.quote: You will find as you look back upon your life that the moments when you have truly lived are the moments when you have done things in the spirit of love.
quote750.author: Henry Drummond

quote751.quote: Love works a different way in different minds, the fool it enlightens and the wise it blinds.
quote751.author: John Dryden

quote753.quote: Love is not in our choice but in our fate.
quote753.author: John Dryden

quote754.quote: We only love truly once. It is the first time and succeeding passions are less uncontrolled.
quote754.author: Du Coeur

quote755.quote: The pain of love is the pain of being alive. It is a perpetual wound.
quote755.author: Maureen Duffy

quote756.quote: Art is not necessary at all. All that is necessary to make this world a better place to live in is to love --to love as Christ loved, as Buddha loved.
quote756.author: Isadora Duncan

quote757.quote: It was the men I deceived the most that I loved the most.
quote757.author: Marguerite Duras

quote758.quote: To love one child and to love all children, whether living or dead --somewhere these two loves come together. To love a no-good but humble punk and to love an honest man who believes himself to be an honest man --somewhere these, too, come together.
quote758.author: Marguerite Duras
